MeatRecipes3 ID step
MeatRecipes3 ID step
855b53e5-37f9-4801-aa0b-ec0ed5e243f2 Gather the ingredients.
855b53e5-37f9-4801-aa0b-ec0ed5e243f2 Place a skillet, sauté pan, or saucier over medium-low heat and add the butter. Cook, constantly stirring, until the butter has melted and begins to get foamy. This might take 1 to 2 minutes.
855b53e5-37f9-4801-aa0b-ec0ed5e243f2 Sprinkle the flour over the butter and stir or whisk until smooth and well blended, approximately 2 minutes.
855b53e5-37f9-4801-aa0b-ec0ed5e243f2 Continue cooking the flour and butter, while stirring or whisking, for 2 to 3 minutes. This step is essential and requires care because the roux could easily burn; keep an eye on the mixture for the whole time.
855b53e5-37f9-4801-aa0b-ec0ed5e243f2 Gradually whisk in the stock, stirring until well blended. Cook, constantly stirring, until the gravy begins to bubble and thicken. If your gravy seems too thin, mix in a bowl a few tablespoons of flour with the same amount of cold water until a smooth paste has formed. Slowly stir the water-flour paste into the boiling gravy until it is thickened as desired. On the contrary, if the gravy seems too thick, thin it with more stock, broth, or water. Cook, stirring, for 8 to 10 minutes.
855b53e5-37f9-4801-aa0b-ec0ed5e243f2 If using, add browning sauce, a few drops at a time, until you have a nice rich color. Don't pour directly from the bottle, because your gravy could end up darker in color than you'd like. Taste the gravy and add the optional kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste. Cook for an extra 2 to 3 minutes.
855b53e5-37f9-4801-aa0b-ec0ed5e243f2 Pour the gravy through a fine-mesh sieve into a serving bowl with a ladle or into a gravy boat.
855b53e5-37f9-4801-aa0b-ec0ed5e243f2 Enjoy!
33817c0c-0d96-4ee9-a6cb-8037a5fd6691 Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 F.
33817c0c-0d96-4ee9-a6cb-8037a5fd6691 Line up the wings on a baking pan fitted with a rack. Sprinkle the wings on all sides with salt and pepper.
33817c0c-0d96-4ee9-a6cb-8037a5fd6691 Pour in a cup of water and cover the pan. Roast until the meat is tender when you poke it with a fork, but not falling apart, about 1 1/2 hours.
33817c0c-0d96-4ee9-a6cb-8037a5fd6691 Uncover the wings, increase the oven temperature to 450 F, and roast them until the skin becomes firm and crisp, about 15 more minutes.
33817c0c-0d96-4ee9-a6cb-8037a5fd6691 Meanwhile make the sauce: Melt a stick of butter in a pan on medium heat. Add hot sauce. Transfer the sauce to a large bowl.
33817c0c-0d96-4ee9-a6cb-8037a5fd6691 Take the wings from the oven and toss them with the sauce in the bowl.
33817c0c-0d96-4ee9-a6cb-8037a5fd6691 Serve wings with blue cheese or ranch dressing, carrot and celery sticks. Enjoy!
8f0046c2-92ca-4400-98fe-4eb74d468722 Add one tablespoon of the olive oil to a large skillet or cast iron pan. Do not use a non-stick skillet for this. Add the ground turkey and brown it for 5 to 7 minutes, breaking it up with a spatula or wooden spoon as you cook. When it is ready, move the cooked turkey to a plate and set aside while you saute the vegetables. Note that this dish works equally well with ground chicken.
8f0046c2-92ca-4400-98fe-4eb74d468722 Add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil to the pan along with the diced onion. Saute on medium high heat, stirring often, for about one minute. Add the broccoli florets (these should be cut small) and the diced red bell pepper. Continue sauteing and stirring for another couple of minutes until the vegetables begin to soften.
8f0046c2-92ca-4400-98fe-4eb74d468722 Add the finely minced garlic and continue sauteing for an additional minute. Then return the browned ground turkey to the pan.
8f0046c2-92ca-4400-98fe-4eb74d468722 Add in the soy sauce and continue cooking and stirring for another couple of minutes, until the turkey has heated through and all the vegetables are combined. Serve over cooked white rice.
8f0046c2-92ca-4400-98fe-4eb74d468722 Optional ingredients include julienned carrots and a splash of hot sauce or chili paste if you like your food spicy.
c6267f1f-c225-41e5-a4ae-aea74494d2a0 Gather the ingredients.
c6267f1f-c225-41e5-a4ae-aea74494d2a0 Mix the brine ingredients together in a container that's large enough to fully submerge the turkey breast. A large stock pot works well.
c6267f1f-c225-41e5-a4ae-aea74494d2a0 Add the turkey breast to the water and weigh it down with a heavy plate, if necessary, then cover with a lid. Place it in the refrigerator and allow it to brine for at least 18 hours or up to 24 hours.
c6267f1f-c225-41e5-a4ae-aea74494d2a0 Remove the turkey breast from the refrigerator and pat it completely dry with paper towels.
c6267f1f-c225-41e5-a4ae-aea74494d2a0 Mix together the softened butter, garlic powder, poultry seasoning, ground sage, and salt and pepper in a bowl. Combine until its evenly mixed.
c6267f1f-c225-41e5-a4ae-aea74494d2a0 Place the turkey breast into the bin of the air fryer, breast side down.
c6267f1f-c225-41e5-a4ae-aea74494d2a0 Cook for 45 minutes at 375 F.
c6267f1f-c225-41e5-a4ae-aea74494d2a0 Flip the turkey breast and cook for an additional 30 minutes at 375 F, or until the top of the breast is golden brown and the internal temperature reaches 165 F.
c6267f1f-c225-41e5-a4ae-aea74494d2a0 Remove from the air fryer and allow it to rest for ten minutes.
c6267f1f-c225-41e5-a4ae-aea74494d2a0 Remove the breasts from the bone and then slice and serve!
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Gather the ingredients.
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Pat the turkey breast with paper towels to dry; do not remove the netting.
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Peel the garlic; mince or put it through a garlic press. Transfer the garlic to a small bowl and add the paprika, minced thyme, minced rosemary, pepper, and kosher salt. Mix thoroughly. Rub the turkey breast all over with the garlic and spice mixture.
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Select the high sauté setting on the Instant Pot and add the olive oil or ghee. Place the turkey breast in the Instant Pot and cook for about 8 to 10 minutes, turning to brown all sides. Alternatively, sear the turkey breast in a large skillet over medium heat.
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Remove the turkey breast to a plate and place the rack in the Instant Pot. Add the chicken stock to the pot along with a few sprigs of herbs, if desired. Return the turkey breast to the Instant Pot.
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Lock the lid in place and ensure the vent is set to "sealing." Choose the manual setting; adjust the pressure to high and set the time for 35 minutes. When the time is up, let the pressure release naturally for 10 minutes. Check the temperature of the turkey with an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center. If the turkey is not at least 165 F, lock the lid in place and continue to cook it for a few more minutes. Remove the turkey breast to a platter; tent with foil and keep warm.
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Strain the drippings into a bowl or gravy separator and skim off excess fat. Measure 2 cups of strained drippings and set aside.
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Select the normal/medium sauté setting on the Instant Pot. Melt the 4 tablespoons of butter in the pot, then add the flour. Cook the butter and flour mixture, constantly stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually add the reserved 2 cups of drippings and continue cooking, frequently stirring, until the gravy is thickened. Taste and add salt and pepper as needed.
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Carefully remove the netting from the turkey breast and slice thinly.
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Slice the turkey breast and serve it with the gravy, cranberry sauce, mashed potatoes, or any of your favorite side dishes.
8eaf9ccc-9470-4644-9e24-2a972bf3262c Enjoy!
dad1abd4-09ed-4a2c-9744-cfae8c587897 Gather the ingredients.
dad1abd4-09ed-4a2c-9744-cfae8c587897 In a large cast iron pot, cook bacon until all fat has been released.
dad1abd4-09ed-4a2c-9744-cfae8c587897 Remove cooked bacon with slotted spoon and set to the side.
dad1abd4-09ed-4a2c-9744-cfae8c587897 Combine the fat with flour.
dad1abd4-09ed-4a2c-9744-cfae8c587897 Stir the mixture slowly and constantly for 20 to 25 minutes over low heat until it reaches a deep yellow color.
dad1abd4-09ed-4a2c-9744-cfae8c587897 Add your chopped onions, bell pepper, garlic and celery to the roux and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.Add the sausage and the Cajun seasoning and cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes.
dad1abd4-09ed-4a2c-9744-cfae8c587897 Add the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, uncovered, for 45 minutes.
dad1abd4-09ed-4a2c-9744-cfae8c587897 Add the turkey meat, shrimp, okra, and extra stuffing, if using, and cook for 15 to 20 minutes.
dad1abd4-09ed-4a2c-9744-cfae8c587897 Serve with steamed rice and top with green onions.
b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c Gather the ingredients. Place a rack in a large roasting pan and preheat the oven to 350 F.
b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c Remove the thawed turkey from its packaging and pat dry with paper towels. Remove the innards and discard them or use them to make homemade stock. Place the turkey on the rack in the roasting pan and sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Rub the inside of the cavity with salt and add the carrot, celery, onion, and sprigs of herbs. Tuck the wings under the bird and tie the drumsticks together with kitchen twine.
b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c Melt 6 tablespoons of butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the fresh chopped herbs and bring to a simmer.
b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c Brush the turkey with the butter and herb mixture. Place in the oven and roast for 1 hour and 45 minutes. Place a foil tent over the turkey and continue to roast for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours longer, basting every 20 to 30 minutes. The turkey should register about 156 F to 160 F in the breast meat and about 170 in the thigh (make sure the thermometer is in the thickest part of the meat and is not touching bone).
b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c Remove the turkey to a platter and let it rest for 20 to 30 minutes.
b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c While the turkey rests, prepare the gravy. Pour the pan drippings into a gravy separator and let stand for 2 minutes, until the fat rises to the top. Pour the broth into a cup or bowl, leaving the fat in the separator. Set the defatted broth aside and measure 1/2 cup of fat. If you don't have 1/2 cup of fat, add butter to make 1/2 cup. Pour the fat into a saucepan and place it over medium-low heat.
b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c Add the flour to the hot fat and cook the roux, whisking constantly, for 2 minutes.
b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c Whisk in the reserved defatted broth along with 2 cups of chicken stock. Continue to cook, constantly whisking, until the gravy is thickened. Add more stock to thin the gravy, as desired. Taste the gravy and add salt and pepper, as needed.
b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c Strain the gravy, if desired, and pour it into a gravy boat or serving bowl. Serve the gravy with the turkey.
659bac8c-f73d-4fed-a30b-246334a1c806 Gather the ingredients.
659bac8c-f73d-4fed-a30b-246334a1c806 Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the Instant Pot and choose the sauté setting. Add the chopped onion, bell pepper, and shredded carrots and cook, frequently stirring, for about 4 minutes or until the vegetables are softened.
659bac8c-f73d-4fed-a30b-246334a1c806 Remove the vegetables to a plate and set aside. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the pot along with the ground turkey. Cook, stirring, until the turkey is no longer pink. Add the chopped jalapeño peppers and garlic and cook for 1 minute longer.
659bac8c-f73d-4fed-a30b-246334a1c806 Add the onion, bell pepper, and carrot back to the pot along with the Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, cumin, and pepper. Stir to blend.
659bac8c-f73d-4fed-a30b-246334a1c806 Add the tomatoes, undrained beans, and chicken stock to the pot. Stir to blend.
659bac8c-f73d-4fed-a30b-246334a1c806 Lock the lid in place and make sure the knob is in the "sealing" position. Choose the manual setting, high pressure, and set the timer to 20 minutes.
659bac8c-f73d-4fed-a30b-246334a1c806 When the time is up, let the pressure release naturally for 15 minutes.
659bac8c-f73d-4fed-a30b-246334a1c806 Enjoy the big bowl of chili with freshly baked cornbread and your favorite toppings. Croutons, shredded cheese, sour cream, cilantro leaves, and chilies are excellent garnish options.
daeda891-4568-4ae1-9aff-4e980541ea84 Gather the ingredients.
daeda891-4568-4ae1-9aff-4e980541ea84 Preheat a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the oil, followed by the onion. Sauté for 2 minutes.
daeda891-4568-4ae1-9aff-4e980541ea84 Add the bell pepper, jalapeño and garlic. Sauté for 2 more minutes.
daeda891-4568-4ae1-9aff-4e980541ea84 Add the chili powder, cumin, and oregano and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
daeda891-4568-4ae1-9aff-4e980541ea84 Add the tomatoes and juice, pinto beans, turkey and broth, and stir. Season with salt and pepper.
daeda891-4568-4ae1-9aff-4e980541ea84 Turn up the heat and bring to a simmer.
daeda891-4568-4ae1-9aff-4e980541ea84 Turn the heat to low and let simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
daeda891-4568-4ae1-9aff-4e980541ea84 Serve topped with diced avocado or a dollop of sour cream and tortilla chips.
d26d1f1c-cb33-4e07-a10a-eef199a254fd Gather the ingredients.
d26d1f1c-cb33-4e07-a10a-eef199a254fd Combine everything and mix well.
d26d1f1c-cb33-4e07-a10a-eef199a254fd Keep refrigerated until you need to use it and mix before adding to poultry.
0abab757-b51e-412f-8ee4-23b9061367b0 Gather the ingredients. Preheat oven to 350 F.
0abab757-b51e-412f-8ee4-23b9061367b0 Combine everything in a large bowl.
0abab757-b51e-412f-8ee4-23b9061367b0 Spoon the mixture into a greased 1 1/2-quart casserole dish.
0abab757-b51e-412f-8ee4-23b9061367b0 Cover and bake 30 to 40 minutes, until bubbly.
0abab757-b51e-412f-8ee4-23b9061367b0 Serve and enjoy!
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de Gather the ingredients.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de Add the butter to the flour mixture and combine using two forks or a pastry blender until the butter is the size of small peas. You can also use a food processor to combine the ingredients as well.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de Pour the buttermilk over the flour and butter mixture and stir with a spatula to combine until it becomes a soft dough. Be careful not to overwork the dough. The less it is mixed up, the more tender the dumplings will be.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de After you have created the dough for the dumplings, heat the broth in a large dutch oven or pot until boiling.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de While the broth is heating, dust a clean kitchen surface with a generous amount of flour and roll out the dough into a 1/4-inch thick sheet.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de Slice the dough into small squares using a pizza cutter to create the dumplings.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de Add the dumplings a few at a time into the boiling broth, making sure not to dust off too much of the extra flour as it will thicken the broth.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de Continue adding dumplings until there are no more left. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until the dumplings are tender and fluffy and the broth has thickened.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de Add the cooked turkey to the broth and heat until it is warmed through.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de Add salt and pepper to taste.
d239530b-e995-4e15-afb1-efb3648c36de Serve with the parsley if using and enjoy.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Gather the ingredients.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Chop the leftover turkey into small pieces and add to a mixing bowl. Do not include any skin.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Chop the leftover stuffing and add it to the mixing bowl.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Dice the brie and add it to the turkey and stuffing. Mix to combine the three ingredients.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Heat the oil to 375 F, using a candy thermometer to monitor the temperature.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Beat the egg in a small bowl, and then beat in the water to create an egg wash.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Place an egg roll wrapper on a plate or other flat surface so that one corner is facing you.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Place a 1/4 cup of the filling mixture close to the corner. Fold the corner over the filling; fold in each side and roll until almost completely rolled up.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Brush the far corner with the egg wash and continue rolling the egg roll until it's completely rolled. Place on a flour-dusted baking sheet and repeat with remaining egg rolls and filling.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Fry 3 to 4 egg rolls in the hot oil until they are golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Remove from the oil and place on a paper towel-lined plate to absorb the extra grease. Repeat until all of the egg rolls are cooked. Keep them warm in a 200 F oven while you prepare the sauce.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Place the cranberry sauce ingredients in a small saucepan and heat until the ingredients are heated through, stirring to combine.
15ffab8d-2c06-4bc4-a026-9091fbb81ce4 Serve with the egg rolls immediately.
dfe62f9a-478b-4b9a-a974-840820123931 Gather the ingredients.
dfe62f9a-478b-4b9a-a974-840820123931 Preheat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4. Butter bottom and sides of 2-quart baking dish.
dfe62f9a-478b-4b9a-a974-840820123931 Arrange half of the dressing in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
dfe62f9a-478b-4b9a-a974-840820123931 Add half of the turkey then top with half of the gravy.
dfe62f9a-478b-4b9a-a974-840820123931 Repeat the layers.
dfe62f9a-478b-4b9a-a974-840820123931 Top with cubes of cranberry sauce.
dfe62f9a-478b-4b9a-a974-840820123931 Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes.
dfe62f9a-478b-4b9a-a974-840820123931 Serve and enjoy!
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Gather the ingredients.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Heat the oven to broil, around 500 F. Make sure to have a rack close to the top of the oven.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Quickly warm the burrito-sized tortilla in the microwave for about 20 seconds. This makes it easy to fold.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Place the tortilla on a large oven-safe plate, then smear the center with sour cream.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Separately, heat up the roast turkey, mashed potatoes, and leftover stuffing. You can microwave for faster results).
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Drop the turkey mixture onto the center of the warmed tortilla, covering the sour cream.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Roll the burrito by folding the end of the burrito over the filling and then folding in the sides while rolling the tortilla.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Heat the gravy in a small pot on medium-low heat until it is hot.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Pour the gravy over the top of the burrito while it is on the oven proof plate. Cover as much, or as little, of the burrito that you wish.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Sprinkle the top of the burrito with the shredded cheese.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Place the burrito under the broiler for about 1 minute, or until the cheese is melted.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Sprinkle with chopped parsley, if using.
a57a8132-27dc-442b-9912-c468f1077bcb Serve with leftover cranberry sauce on the side.
e7c69743-5930-406e-80a9-8754e806d7b1 Gather the ingredients.
e7c69743-5930-406e-80a9-8754e806d7b1 Shred or chop the roasted turkey meat into bite-sized pieces.
e7c69743-5930-406e-80a9-8754e806d7b1 Whisk together the mayonnaise, sour cream, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
e7c69743-5930-406e-80a9-8754e806d7b1 Add the shredded turkey, sharp cheddar cheese and scallions. Stir to completely combine and coat the chicken. Cover and place in the refrigerator while preparing the cranberry mustard.
e7c69743-5930-406e-80a9-8754e806d7b1 In a small saucepan, combine the frozen cranberries and water. Heat on medium low for about 10 to 15 minutes or until the cranberries have burst and are softened.
e7c69743-5930-406e-80a9-8754e806d7b1 Add the mustard and maple syrup to the cranberries and stir to combine. Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes.
e7c69743-5930-406e-80a9-8754e806d7b1 Remove the cranberry mixture from the heat. Use an immersion blender to blend the ingredients until completely smooth, then add salt to taste. Cool the mustard in the refrigerator.
e7c69743-5930-406e-80a9-8754e806d7b1 Place about a 1/3 cup of the turkey mixture in each butter lettuce leaf and drizzle with the cranberry mustard.
e7c69743-5930-406e-80a9-8754e806d7b1 Serve and enjoy!
11749ed6-8525-41b4-b837-fb7d11ce12fc Gather the ingredients and preheat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4.
11749ed6-8525-41b4-b837-fb7d11ce12fc Grease a 2 1/2- to 3-quart casserole dish.
11749ed6-8525-41b4-b837-fb7d11ce12fc Cook the spaghetti in boiling salted water following the package directions. Drain well.
11749ed6-8525-41b4-b837-fb7d11ce12fc In a large bowl, combine the cooked and drained spaghetti with 1 cup of cheddar cheese and 2 tablespoons of the Parmesan cheese.
11749ed6-8525-41b4-b837-fb7d11ce12fc Add the diced turkey and pimientos.
11749ed6-8525-41b4-b837-fb7d11ce12fc In a skillet or saute pan, melt butter and saute the mushrooms and onions until they are tender and most of the liquid has evaporated; add to the turkey mixture along with remaining ingredients. Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed. Gently stir to combine ingredients.
11749ed6-8525-41b4-b837-fb7d11ce12fc Transfer the mixture to the prepared casserole and sprinkle with remaining cheddar and Parmesan cheeses.
11749ed6-8525-41b4-b837-fb7d11ce12fc Cover the baking dish with a lid or foil and bake for about 45 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.
11749ed6-8525-41b4-b837-fb7d11ce12fc If desired, place the casserole under the broiler (high heat) for about 4 to 6 minutes, or until the top is lightly browned.
11749ed6-8525-41b4-b837-fb7d11ce12fc Serve and enjoy!
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Gather the ingredients.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Place 2 1/4 cups of the bread stuffing in a bowl. Place 1 1/2 cups of the cornbread stuffing in another bowl.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Place the remaining 1/2 cup of bread stuffing in a third bowl and add the remaining 1/2 cup of the cornbread stuffing. Add the whole berry cranberry sauce and pecans and toss gently to combine. You should now have 3 separate bowls of stuffings.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 In a food processor fitted with the metal blade, combine the butter, garlic, sage, and thyme until the herbs are finely chopped.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Gently run your hand under the turkey skin to make sort of a pocket, but do not separate the skin completely from the meat. Distribute the herb butter mixture evenly under the skin.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Rub the skin with the browning sauce, then the olive oil. Sprinkle generously with kosher salt and freshly ground pepper.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Preheat the oven to 300 F. Flip the deboned turkey over so it is open and skin-side down. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Spread bread stuffing evenly over the turkey cavity.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Place the duck on top of the bread stuffing, skin-side down. Spread the cranberry nut stuffing on top of the open duck cavity.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Top with the chicken, skin-side down. Spread cornbread stuffing on top of the open chicken cavity. Skewer the back of the chicken closed.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Bring up the sides of the duck to cover the chicken. Skewer the back of the duck closed.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Repeat the process with the turkey.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Carefully turn the turducken over so it is seam-side down and breast-side up. If possible, remove all skewers except the last one holding the turkey together.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Place the turducken in a heavy roaster. Roast 3 to 4 hours, or until a meat thermometer inserted in the very center of the chicken stuffing reaches 165 F. Baste once per hour with pan juices. If turducken begins to get too brown, tent loosely with heavy-duty aluminum foil that has been coated with vegetable spray.
674bfd82-310b-46a3-8847-d04143940578 Let the turducken rest 30 minutes before carving. Slice the turducken across the breast to show off each layer.
80ca334e-34bb-4894-8a8b-dcfd6c241a9e Gather the ingredients.
80ca334e-34bb-4894-8a8b-dcfd6c241a9e Put the bacon in a large skillet and place the skillet over medium heat. Cook until the bacon has rendered its fat. With a slotted spoon, remove the bacon pieces to paper towels to drain. You should have about 1/4 to 1/3 cup of drippings left in the pan. Refrigerate the crumbled bacon to use as a garnish or save it for another use.
80ca334e-34bb-4894-8a8b-dcfd6c241a9e Remove 2 tablespoons of oil from the 3/4 cup and set it aside. Add the remaining oilabout 2/3 cupto the bacon drippings. Add the flour to the bacon drippings and oil mixture and cook over medium heat, constantly stirring, for about 25 to 30 minutes, or until the roux is the color of milk chocolate. Remove the roux from the heat and set it aside.
80ca334e-34bb-4894-8a8b-dcfd6c241a9e Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the smoked sausage and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
80ca334e-34bb-4894-8a8b-dcfd6c241a9e Add the onions, celery, green and red bell pepper, and the white and light green parts of the green onions to the sausage; continue to cook for about 4 minutes, or until the vegetables are soft. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer.
80ca334e-34bb-4894-8a8b-dcfd6c241a9e To the vegetables and sausage, add the reserved roux; stir to combine.
80ca334e-34bb-4894-8a8b-dcfd6c241a9e Gradually add 2 cups the chicken stock to the pot a little at a time, stirring constantly. Add the chopped turkey, Worcestershire sauce, bay leaves, salt, Cajun seasoning, thyme, and black pepper. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally. If too thick, add more stock in small amounts.
80ca334e-34bb-4894-8a8b-dcfd6c241a9e Stir the parsley and chopped green onions (dark green parts) into the gumbo and serve it over hot steamed rice.
80ca334e-34bb-4894-8a8b-dcfd6c241a9e Garnish the turkey gumbo with extra green onions, parsley, and the crumbled cooked bacon, if desired.
c357f607-04ef-4bfc-991c-9f9609eaea0c Gather the ingredients.
c357f607-04ef-4bfc-991c-9f9609eaea0c In a large bowl, combine the celery, chopped red onion, diced turkey, and parsley, if using.
c357f607-04ef-4bfc-991c-9f9609eaea0c Toss to blend ingredients.
c357f607-04ef-4bfc-991c-9f9609eaea0c In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, 1/2 cup mayonnaise, and freshly ground black pepper.
c357f607-04ef-4bfc-991c-9f9609eaea0c Stir into the turkey mixture until blended, adding more mayonnaise if needed. Add salt, to taste.
c357f607-04ef-4bfc-991c-9f9609eaea0c Line slices of bread or rolls with lettuce leaves, if desired, and fill with the turkey mixture.
c357f607-04ef-4bfc-991c-9f9609eaea0c Serve sandwiches with potato chips or fries and sliced dill pickles for a delicious lunch or sandwich supper. Alternatively, serve the turkey salad on lettuce leaves or spring greens with sliced tomatoes or avocado wedges.
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 Gather the ingredients.
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 Place the turkey breast in a large cooking bag; place the bag with the turkey in a large roasting pan or another large container (just in case the bag leaks).
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 Add the brine ingredients to the bag and then close the bag and twist until brine is covering turkey. Use a twist-tie to secure the bag. Alternately, you can use a large, nonreactive covered container. Just make sure the turkey is completely covered with brine (you might have to increase the amount of brine for a container). Place the turkey breast in the refrigerator for up to 24 hours.
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 Heat oven to 400 F/200 C/Gas 6.
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 Remove turkey from brine and rinse it thoroughly with cold water; pat dry with paper towels.
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 Place the turkey breast on a rack, breast side up, in a large roasting pan. Discard brine.
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 Rub the turkey with vegetable oil, butter or extra-virgin olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper or a seasoned salt blend.
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 If desired, fill the cavity of the turkey breast with chunks of onion, fruit and fresh herbs.
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 Place a meat thermometer in the thickest part of the breast, not touching bone.
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 Roast at 400 F/200 C/Gas 6 for 20 minutes. Reduce heat to 325 F/165 C/Gas 3 and continue roasting until the turkey breast registers at least 165 F/74 C, about 2 to 3 hours.
c3f211b2-77b3-4962-be57-e987d8e66be3 Serve and enjoy!
b9ab79dc-515c-4002-9d56-fa1e0c3f4116 Gather the ingredients and preheat oven to 425 F.
b9ab79dc-515c-4002-9d56-fa1e0c3f4116 Place the turkey breast on a rack in a roasting pan.
b9ab79dc-515c-4002-9d56-fa1e0c3f4116 Brush turkey with the melted butter, then season generously with Kosher salt and black pepper.
b9ab79dc-515c-4002-9d56-fa1e0c3f4116 Roast for 45 minutes to 1 hour, basting twice with stockonce after about 15 minutes and again about 15 minutes later (see note below)
b9ab79dc-515c-4002-9d56-fa1e0c3f4116 When thermometer reads 155 F, remove the turkey from the oven.
b9ab79dc-515c-4002-9d56-fa1e0c3f4116 Cover loosely with foil and let it rest for about 20 minutes (or when the thermometer reads 120 F) before carving and serving.
b9ab79dc-515c-4002-9d56-fa1e0c3f4116 Serve and enjoy
276efb5d-fcc4-41a5-ab5f-6ac33e1c477f Gather the ingredients.
276efb5d-fcc4-41a5-ab5f-6ac33e1c477f Combine the liquid smoke, soy sauce, Tabasco, Worcestershire, mesquite, brown sugar, onion powder, garlic powder, and kosher salt in a large zip-top bag.
276efb5d-fcc4-41a5-ab5f-6ac33e1c477f Add thinly-sliced turkey strips to the marinade, seal, and squish to coat all the meat. Re-open the bag, squeeze out all the air, re-seal, and refrigerate 12 to 24 hours.
276efb5d-fcc4-41a5-ab5f-6ac33e1c477f Remove the turkey strips from marinade and gently pat off excess moisture with a paper towel.
276efb5d-fcc4-41a5-ab5f-6ac33e1c477f Dehydrate until the turkey jerky is leathery and chewy, but not crisp enough to snap when bent.
276efb5d-fcc4-41a5-ab5f-6ac33e1c477f Place the marinated strips in a single layer, with space in between, on dehydrator racks.
276efb5d-fcc4-41a5-ab5f-6ac33e1c477f Store the jerky in sealed bags in the refrigerator.
67f85f93-6f0e-41de-9c28-ba23726e6849 Gather the ingredients.
67f85f93-6f0e-41de-9c28-ba23726e6849 Check to make sure that the turkey will fit the grill with 1 inch of clearance on all sides.
67f85f93-6f0e-41de-9c28-ba23726e6849 Combine the seasoning ingredients in a small bowl.
67f85f93-6f0e-41de-9c28-ba23726e6849 Slather the inside and outside of turkey with the mixture, making sure to get seasonings under the skin. If this proves to be difficult, melt the mixture and use a marinade injector to deposit seasonings into the bird.
67f85f93-6f0e-41de-9c28-ba23726e6849 Thread the turkey onto the spit through the neck skin and out just below the tail.
67f85f93-6f0e-41de-9c28-ba23726e6849 Thread onion onto the spit so that it rests inside the turkey. Fasten tightly with spit forks.
67f85f93-6f0e-41de-9c28-ba23726e6849 Tie wings and legs with string tightly to the body of the turkey. Hold spit on each side of the turkey and roll it in your hands to check the balance. Readjust, if necessary, so that it will turn evenly.
67f85f93-6f0e-41de-9c28-ba23726e6849 Remove cooking racks from grill and preheat. Place drip pan under where the turkey will turn. If using charcoal, place hot coals around the edge with few coals directly under the turkey.
67f85f93-6f0e-41de-9c28-ba23726e6849 Grill over a medium heat until the skin starts to blister and brown. Reduce heat and continue grilling until the turkey reaches an internal temperature (measure in the center of the breast) of 185 F. Plan on a cooking time of about 3 to 3 1/2 hours for a 12-pound turkey.
67f85f93-6f0e-41de-9c28-ba23726e6849 Carve and enjoy.
ef35b1dd-a52a-4dc7-bbca-ed05d0204418 Gather the ingredients.
ef35b1dd-a52a-4dc7-bbca-ed05d0204418 Spray the crockpot with nonstick cooking spray.
ef35b1dd-a52a-4dc7-bbca-ed05d0204418 Place the chunks of celery and carrots in the slow cooker. The vegetables will act as a rack.
ef35b1dd-a52a-4dc7-bbca-ed05d0204418 Sprinkle salt and pepper over the turkey breast and arrange in a large slow cooker. Pour melted butter over the turkey.
ef35b1dd-a52a-4dc7-bbca-ed05d0204418 Cover and cook on HIGH for about 5 to 6 hours, or until turkey is done and juices run clear when pierced with a knife. A boneless turkey breast might take less time, so check for doneness earlier.
ef35b1dd-a52a-4dc7-bbca-ed05d0204418 To be sure the turkey is fully cooked, check the temperature with a reliable food thermometer. The minimum safe temperature for turkey and other poultry is 165 F.
ef35b1dd-a52a-4dc7-bbca-ed05d0204418 Pour the juices from the slow cooker into a saucepan. Bring to boil slowly.
ef35b1dd-a52a-4dc7-bbca-ed05d0204418 Combine the cornstarch and water together and then add to the saucepan.
ef35b1dd-a52a-4dc7-bbca-ed05d0204418 Add some turkey or chicken stock, about 1/2 to 1 cup, depending on the amount of liquid left in the crockpot. Whisk over medium-low heat until smooth and thickened.
ef35b1dd-a52a-4dc7-bbca-ed05d0204418 Serve the sliced turkey breast on a plate topped with the turkey gravy.
3f53045f-3488-489c-8b93-5721bba45019 Gather the ingredients and preheat the oven to 400 F.
3f53045f-3488-489c-8b93-5721bba45019 Bake the bacon for 10 minutes. You can also brown in a pan.
3f53045f-3488-489c-8b93-5721bba45019 Whisk together the mayonnaise, lemon juice, and garlic powder in a small bowl.
3f53045f-3488-489c-8b93-5721bba45019 Toast the bread so that it is still slightly soft, but also a nice light brown color. Place it on a cooling rack if you can, so that it doesn't get soggy while you prepare the sandwich.
3f53045f-3488-489c-8b93-5721bba45019 Place one slice of toast on a cutting board. Add two slices of turkey, top with a small handful of fresh spinach, a slice of tomato, and 2 slices of bacon.
3f53045f-3488-489c-8b93-5721bba45019 Layer another slice of toast on top. Place three more slices of turkey, 4 slices of fresh avocado, and two more pieces of bacon.
3f53045f-3488-489c-8b93-5721bba45019 Spread some of the aioli onto the last slice of toast. Place the toast aioli side down on top of the sandwich.
3f53045f-3488-489c-8b93-5721bba45019 Cut into four triangles, secure each piece with a toothpick.
3f53045f-3488-489c-8b93-5721bba45019 Serve and enjoy!
03ee1722-8d07-4d79-9177-8fad161a5bbf Gather the ingredients.
03ee1722-8d07-4d79-9177-8fad161a5bbf Heat the oven to 450 F.
03ee1722-8d07-4d79-9177-8fad161a5bbf Line a large baking pan with foil and spray with nonstick spray (jelly roll pan, baking pan, or roasting pan).
03ee1722-8d07-4d79-9177-8fad161a5bbf Sprinkle the turkey cutlets all over with the salt and pepper.
03ee1722-8d07-4d79-9177-8fad161a5bbf Set up three breading trays or shallow bowls. Put flour in a breading tray or bowl. In another breading tray or bowl, combine the crumbs and Parmesan cheese.
03ee1722-8d07-4d79-9177-8fad161a5bbf Beat the eggs, egg whites, water, and Dijon together and pour into another tray or bowl.
03ee1722-8d07-4d79-9177-8fad161a5bbf One at a time, dip cutlets in the flour, then dip in the egg mixture, then dredge in the crumb mixture until thoroughly coated.
03ee1722-8d07-4d79-9177-8fad161a5bbf Arrange the cutlets on the prepared baking pan. Spray the cutlets lightly with olive oil or canola oil spray or drizzle with melted butter.
03ee1722-8d07-4d79-9177-8fad161a5bbf Bake cutlets for 10 to 15 minutes, or longer if your turkey cutlets are thick. To be sure, use an instant-read food thermometer. The temperature should be at least 165 F on a food thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a cutlet.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 Gather the ingredients and preheat oven to 350 F.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 Lightly grease a 2-quart baking dish or spray with nonstick cooking spray.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 In a skillet, melt the butter and saute the celery, onion, and apple until softened.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 Pour the sauteed onion and apple mixture over the bread cubes in a large bowl and toss to blend.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 Toss with the dried cranberries, if using, poultry seasoning, salt, and a dash of pepper.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 Add 3/4 cup chicken broth and stir until moistened, adding more broth if needed. Taste and adjust seasonings before you add the egg. Stir in the beaten egg until well blended.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 Gently pat the stuffing mixture into the prepared baking dish.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 In a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil or spray the pan with nonstick cooking spray. Sprinkle turkey cutlets with seasoned salt and pepper and saute for about 2 minutes on each side.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 Add the gravy and bring to a boil. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 Arrange the turkey over the stuffing then pour the gravy over all.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.
8656b550-0ad2-4062-bd51-ae7f1414dd02 Serve and enjoy!
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 Gather the ingredients.
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 Preheat oven to 400 F. Spray two baking sheets with nonstick cooking spray and set aside.
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 In a large bowl, combine the turkey, stuffing, and cheese and mix lightly with your hands.
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 Open the tubes of pizza dough and spread the dough out onto a lightly-floured surface. Cut each square of dough in half to make equal rectangles.
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 Mound 1 1/2 cups of the turkey mixture on one half of each of the rectangles, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges.
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 Fold half of the pizza dough over the stuffing to enclose. Press and fold the edges to seal.
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 Cut vent holes or slits in the top of each calzone. Brush each with some of the beaten egg.
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 Carefully place each calzone on the prepared baking sheets, two per sheet.
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until the calzones are nicely browned and the filling is very hot.
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 Let stand on a wire rack for 5 minutes.
e47c14f3-27f7-4bd8-a94d-ca19102f44f7 Serve and enjoy!
3e484941-07a2-43a8-b533-7324e41bdf85 Gather the ingredients.
3e484941-07a2-43a8-b533-7324e41bdf85 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
3e484941-07a2-43a8-b533-7324e41bdf85 Pat the turkey dry with paper towels. Never rinse the turkey before cooking it as the bacteria on the surface of the meat will aerosolize and spread around your kitchen. A good pat dry is a reliable procedure and enough for the seasonings to adhere to the skin.
3e484941-07a2-43a8-b533-7324e41bdf85 In a small bowl, combine the softened butter, salt, pepper, garlic, thyme, and sage and mix well.
3e484941-07a2-43a8-b533-7324e41bdf85 Loosen the skin from the meat and rub the butter mixture into the meat. Smooth the skin back over and rub the remaining butter mixture on the skin.
3e484941-07a2-43a8-b533-7324e41bdf85 Place the thighs in a roasting pan and pour the broth around the turkey.
3e484941-07a2-43a8-b533-7324e41bdf85 Roast the turkey thighs for 60 to 70 minutes or until a meat thermometer registers 170 F when inserted in the meat away from the bone.
3e484941-07a2-43a8-b533-7324e41bdf85 Remove the pan from the oven, cover tightly with foil or the pan lid, and let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
3e484941-07a2-43a8-b533-7324e41bdf85 Enjoy.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Gather the ingredients.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Combine apple juice, brown sugar, and salt in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil and continue heating until the sugar and salt have dissolved.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Skim off any foam that forms on the top and let cool.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 In a large (five-gallon or larger) stockpot or similar container, combine the apple juice mixture with three quarts of water, oranges, ginger, cloves, bay leaves, and garlic.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Remove any fatty deposit you might find on the turkey and everything from the body cavity.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Place turkey in brine mixture and refrigerate for 24 hours. Make sure that the turkey remains completely submerged.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Place hickory chips in water and prepare grill for indirect grilling on medium heat.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Remove turkey from brine and pat dry with paper towels.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Tie legs together with string and lightly brush turkey with vegetable oil.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Preheat your grill to about 325 F/165 C. Place turkey on a roasting rack inside a foil pan. Place on the grill away from direct heat.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 After 30 to 40 minutes, you will need to wrap the wings in foil to keep them from burning.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Brush with vegetable oil periodically. If the breasts start to get too brown, cover with foil. The smoked turkey is done when the internal temperature reaches about 175 F/80 C in the thigh or about 165 F/75 C in the breast. You should expect it to take about 12 to 14 minutes per pound.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 When done, remove from grill and let rest for about 15 minutes.
6712db55-ee0a-4ee1-a211-002ee798fbd4 Carve and serve!
5289cd74-05bc-4c5f-aee5-8f6be6f2153a Gather the ingredients.
5289cd74-05bc-4c5f-aee5-8f6be6f2153a In a large skillet, melt the butter and add the curry powder, stirring for 2 minutes.
5289cd74-05bc-4c5f-aee5-8f6be6f2153a Add onions and stir frequently, cooking the onions until soft and translucid.
5289cd74-05bc-4c5f-aee5-8f6be6f2153a Add in flour and ginger. Stir vigorously to avoid large clumps.
5289cd74-05bc-4c5f-aee5-8f6be6f2153a Add chicken broth and pineapple. Mix well until there are no visible clumps of flour. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes.
5289cd74-05bc-4c5f-aee5-8f6be6f2153a Stir in turkey and coat all the pieces well.
5289cd74-05bc-4c5f-aee5-8f6be6f2153a Cover the mixture and simmer for 10 more minutes, or until heated through.
5289cd74-05bc-4c5f-aee5-8f6be6f2153a Add in lemon juice and stir.
5289cd74-05bc-4c5f-aee5-8f6be6f2153a Garnish with fresh herbs if using. Serve over hot cooked rice and enjoy!
ffd3cc90-1c51-434d-9c61-8597b315b2f8 Gather the ingredients.
ffd3cc90-1c51-434d-9c61-8597b315b2f8 Pat the turkey dry and place in a roasting pan. Bend the wings and tuck them under the turkey for a neat appearance.
ffd3cc90-1c51-434d-9c61-8597b315b2f8 Preheat the oven to 350 F. Rub the turkey with the butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
ffd3cc90-1c51-434d-9c61-8597b315b2f8 Put the orange segments and thyme sprigs in the turkey cavity. Set the bird aside.
ffd3cc90-1c51-434d-9c61-8597b315b2f8 In a small saucepan, cook the vinegar over medium-high heat until it is reduced to about half.
ffd3cc90-1c51-434d-9c61-8597b315b2f8 Stir in the honey, orange juice, dried thyme, and butter and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
ffd3cc90-1c51-434d-9c61-8597b315b2f8 Brush the turkey with some of the glaze and place in the oven. Roast according to cooking charts for unstuffed or stuffed turkey (depending on what you're doing), brushing with the glaze every 15 minutes for the first hour or until the glaze is used up.
ffd3cc90-1c51-434d-9c61-8597b315b2f8 Continue roasting, basting with the juices in the pan every hour, until a meat thermometer inserted into the turkey thigh (make sure you are not touching the bone) registers 165 F.
ffd3cc90-1c51-434d-9c61-8597b315b2f8 Remove the turkey from the oven, cover it with foil, and let stand while you make finish cooking the rest of your Thanksgiving feast.
ffd3cc90-1c51-434d-9c61-8597b315b2f8 Carve and serve!
4a30c193-6f42-4ceb-9076-8b9944df036c Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 F.
4a30c193-6f42-4ceb-9076-8b9944df036c Pat the turkey legs dry with paper towels and place them in a large roasting pan. Avoid rinsing poultry in the sink; that will just spread bacteria around your kitchen.
4a30c193-6f42-4ceb-9076-8b9944df036c Create a compound butter by mixing the softened butter, salt, pepper, poultry seasoning, and thyme in a small bowl.
4a30c193-6f42-4ceb-9076-8b9944df036c Rub this mixture over the turkey legs. You can also rub it on the flesh under the skin for even more flavor.
4a30c193-6f42-4ceb-9076-8b9944df036c Pour the chicken broth into the pan around the turkey legs. This will help keep the legs moist.
4a30c193-6f42-4ceb-9076-8b9944df036c Roast the turkey legs for 1 hour and 30 minutes to 1 hour and 40 minutes or until a meat thermometer registers 170 F. Remove the roasting pan from the oven, cover it with foil, and let stand for 10 minutes.
4a30c193-6f42-4ceb-9076-8b9944df036c You can serve whole legs or slice the meat off the bones and serve it that way.
4a30c193-6f42-4ceb-9076-8b9944df036c Enjoy.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 Gather the ingredients.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 Cut off and discard the wing tips.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 Cut the turkey wings at the joints between the wingette and the drumette.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 Sprinkle the wings all over with salt and pepper.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 When the oil is hot, add the turkey wing pieces and brown on all sides. This will take approximately 10 minutes.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 Put the chopped onion, celery, and carrots in the bottom of the slow cooker.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 Top with the browned wings.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 In a measuring cup, combine the cream of chicken soup with the water.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 Pour over the wings.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 Cover the crockpot and cook for 3 to 4 hours on HIGH, or until turkey wings are done. The safe minimum temperature for turkey is 165 F.
68820d51-f729-4c8e-be58-31b350c03f63 Serve and enjoy.
bbcfd3a8-20c5-441c-a0b6-f64e87a7aaeb Gather the ingredients.
bbcfd3a8-20c5-441c-a0b6-f64e87a7aaeb Place a large skillet over medium heat. Add 4 tablespoons of butter.
bbcfd3a8-20c5-441c-a0b6-f64e87a7aaeb When the butter is hot, add the celery, onion and the red and green bell pepper. Cook until the vegetables are tender and the onions are translucent, stirring frequently.
bbcfd3a8-20c5-441c-a0b6-f64e87a7aaeb Add the diced potatoes along with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Cook for about 5 to 10 minutes, or until the potatoes are lightly browned.
bbcfd3a8-20c5-441c-a0b6-f64e87a7aaeb Add the chopped turkey, gravy and parsley. Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
bbcfd3a8-20c5-441c-a0b6-f64e87a7aaeb Taste and adjust the seasonings.
bbcfd3a8-20c5-441c-a0b6-f64e87a7aaeb Simmer the mixture, stirring frequently, for about 15 to 20 minutes.
bbcfd3a8-20c5-441c-a0b6-f64e87a7aaeb Serve and enjoy!
fdea062c-b1ef-4412-aebb-863a8370690e Gather the ingredients.
fdea062c-b1ef-4412-aebb-863a8370690e Lay the turkey cutlets between sheets of plastic and pound gently and evenly with a rolling pin to thin slightly.
fdea062c-b1ef-4412-aebb-863a8370690e Combine the flour, salt, black pepper, and the paprika; dredge cutlets to coat both sides.
fdea062c-b1ef-4412-aebb-863a8370690e In a large over medium-low to medium heat, sauté the turkey cutlets, a few at a time, in the 1 tablespoon of oil and 1 tablespoon butter. Cook until browned and cooked through, or about 2 to 3 minutes on each side.
fdea062c-b1ef-4412-aebb-863a8370690e Remove cutlets to a warm plate and keep warm.
fdea062c-b1ef-4412-aebb-863a8370690e Add sliced mushrooms to the skillet along with remaining 1 tablespoon butter. Cook until mushrooms are lightly browned.
fdea062c-b1ef-4412-aebb-863a8370690e Add the broth, wine, rosemary, parsley, and a few shakes of garlic herb seasoning, if using. Increase heat to simmer the mixture briskly until reduced by about 1/3 to 1/2. Decrease the heat to medium-low.
fdea062c-b1ef-4412-aebb-863a8370690e Stir the flour and water mixture into the broth mixture. Cook, stirring, until thickened.
fdea062c-b1ef-4412-aebb-863a8370690e Add about 1/2 cup of the cream. Taste and add more cream if the sauce seems a little too strong. It depends on how much the broth cooked down.
fdea062c-b1ef-4412-aebb-863a8370690e Serve the sauce along with the turkey cutlets with pasta or rice and a salad or vegetable.
694099c8-01c9-4ef9-a28d-1f090e6e4a5f Gather the ingredients.
694099c8-01c9-4ef9-a28d-1f090e6e4a5f Place the turkey breast in the crockpot or slow cooker with the chicken broth.
694099c8-01c9-4ef9-a28d-1f090e6e4a5f Prepare the stuffing mix following the package directions; pack it on or around the turkey, patting down, but not packing it tight.
694099c8-01c9-4ef9-a28d-1f090e6e4a5f Drizzle butter over the stuffing.
694099c8-01c9-4ef9-a28d-1f090e6e4a5f Cover and cook on HIGH for 1 hour. Reduce the setting to LOW and cook for about 4 to 6 hours longer, or until turkey is very tender. Or, continue cooking on HIGH for about 3 to 3 1/2 hours.
694099c8-01c9-4ef9-a28d-1f090e6e4a5f If the dressing gets too soggy, remove it and spread in a shallow greased pan. Bake in a 400 F oven for about 30 minutes, or until brown and crusty.
694099c8-01c9-4ef9-a28d-1f090e6e4a5f Serve with gravy, if desired.
150453b3-4ecc-486c-9a76-821f9a6615be Gather the ingredients.
150453b3-4ecc-486c-9a76-821f9a6615be In a large stockpot or Dutch oven, heat one tablespoon of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sausage and sauté for 6 to 8 minutes, breaking it up with a spatula into small chunks until it is browned.
150453b3-4ecc-486c-9a76-821f9a6615be Drain the sausage in a colander and set aside.
150453b3-4ecc-486c-9a76-821f9a6615be In the same large stockpot or Dutch oven, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and sauté for about 4 minutes until golden. Add the broccoli rabe and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes until the broccoli rabe starts to wilt slightly and begins to become tender, then add the chicken broth.
150453b3-4ecc-486c-9a76-821f9a6615be Add the salt and pepper, turn the heat to high and bring to a simmer.
150453b3-4ecc-486c-9a76-821f9a6615be Keeping the mixture at a summer, add the millet, cooking the soup uncovered for about 20 to 25 minutes until the grains are fairly tender.
150453b3-4ecc-486c-9a76-821f9a6615be Add the crumbled cooked sausage and an additional one cup or more water or additional broth, as needed, if the soup is too thick. Simmer for another 10 minutes to blend the flavors and taste and adjust the amount of salt and pepper as needed.
150453b3-4ecc-486c-9a76-821f9a6615be Serve hot.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 Lightly grease a 9x13x2-inch baking pan.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 Combine the shredded turkey with sour cream, 2 cups of the shredded cheddar cheese, and salt. Stir to blend thoroughly.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 Heat the oil and dip tortillas in until soft and drain. Or, follow package directions for heating tortillas in the microwave oven or conventional oven.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 Stuff the warm tortillas with turkey mixture and roll up. Arrange the filled rolls seam side down, side-by-side in the prepared baking pan.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 Gather the sauce ingredients.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 In a skillet, saute the chile peppers with garlic in the olive oil for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the stewed tomatoes, onions, salt, oregano, and water. Simmer uncovered until the sauce is reduced and thickened, or about 1/2 hour.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 Pour the chile sauce over enchiladas and bake them for about 30 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup of shredded cheese and return them to the oven for a few minutes, or just until the cheese has melted.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 Let the casserole stand for about 5 minutes.
c158c982-a597-40a4-b192-37459df4bf17 Serve and enjoy!
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Gather the ingredients.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Preheat the oven to 325 F.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Grease a 13x9-inch glass baking dish with unsalted butter and set aside.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Cut the turkey tenderloin into thirds crosswise to form 6 pieces. Then, cut a lengthwise slit into each tenderloin half to within 1/2-inch of opposite side.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Open the tenderloins and place smooth side down on the work surface. Pound the tenderloins slightly with a rolling pin or the smooth side of a meat mallet until they are about 1/2-inch thick.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a In a small bowl, combine the melted butter and mustard; brush over the cut sides of the tenderloins.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Place a piece of cheese in the center of open tenderloin on top of the mustard mixture.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Close the tenderloin around the cheese, forming a bundle and securing with toothpicks.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Combine the bread crumbs, flour, Parmesan cheese, thyme, and salt in a shallow dish.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a In another shallow dish, combine the cream and beaten egg.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Dip the filled tenderloins in the egg mixture, then roll in the crumb mixture to coat.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Place the filled and coated turkey tenderloins in the prepared baking dish and bake for 40 to 45 minutes until turkey is thoroughly cooked and registers 165 F on a meat thermometer. Remove the toothpicks.
1d071b9d-45b0-478e-a8e5-ebe9460e233a Serve and enjoy!
34f02e56-d4a9-4c2b-a4f3-c4085e946b42 Gather the ingredients.
34f02e56-d4a9-4c2b-a4f3-c4085e946b42 Place the turkey, water, onion, celery, bell pepper, garlic, 2 teaspoons of the salt, 1 teaspoon of the black pepper, and the cayenne in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat, and gently boil, uncovered, for 45 minutes.
34f02e56-d4a9-4c2b-a4f3-c4085e946b42 Drain, reserving the liquid. Place the meat and cooked vegetables, fresh parsley, and green onions in a food processor and pulse about 20 times until well mixed but not pureed. Transfer to a large bowl.
34f02e56-d4a9-4c2b-a4f3-c4085e946b42 Add rice to the mixture and gently stir to combine, adding the reserved broth 1 tablespoon at a time, until the mixture can be formed into balls and will hold its shape. Taste, and add more seasoning if necessary.
34f02e56-d4a9-4c2b-a4f3-c4085e946b42 Using about 2 tablespoons turkey mixture for each one, shape into balls. These may also be formed into mini balls the size of large marbles to have as hors d'oeuvres. Use about 2 teaspoons turkey mixture for each mini ball. The frying time will be 1 to 2 minutes for these smaller balls.
34f02e56-d4a9-4c2b-a4f3-c4085e946b42 Place flour, eggs, and bread crumbs mixed with the remaining salt and pepper in three separate dishes. Roll the balls in the flour, then the beaten egg, and then in the breadcrumbs.
34f02e56-d4a9-4c2b-a4f3-c4085e946b42 Heat the oil to 375 F in a large saucepan. When the oil is hot add the balls, 5 or 6 at a time, adjusting the heat up or down as necessary to maintain a temperature of about 375 F.
34f02e56-d4a9-4c2b-a4f3-c4085e946b42 Transfer the balls to paper towels as you remove them from the oil; they will take 2 to 3 minutes to fry.
34f02e56-d4a9-4c2b-a4f3-c4085e946b42 Serve and enjoy!
1cd14590-bcf3-44b1-81c7-62b36612fdf8 Gather the ingredients.
1cd14590-bcf3-44b1-81c7-62b36612fdf8 Mash the garlic cloves and salt into a paste using a pilòn (mortar and pestle).
1cd14590-bcf3-44b1-81c7-62b36612fdf8 Add the peppercorns and adobo and crush the ingredients into the paste.
1cd14590-bcf3-44b1-81c7-62b36612fdf8 Stir in the olive oil and apple cider vinegar.
1cd14590-bcf3-44b1-81c7-62b36612fdf8 Rub the mixture under the turkeys skin inside the cavities, then rub the rest of the mixture on top of the skin.
1cd14590-bcf3-44b1-81c7-62b36612fdf8 Roast the turkey according to the manufacturers recommended time and temperature. A 14 to 16-pound turkey will take about 2 to 2 1/2 hours to cook.
1cd14590-bcf3-44b1-81c7-62b36612fdf8 Serve with your favorite Thanksgiving sides and enjoy!
b3e6c7ab-f01a-40f1-a059-5cf8ec2e0046 Gather the ingredients.
b3e6c7ab-f01a-40f1-a059-5cf8ec2e0046 Combine soup and water in the slow cooker. Stir to blend well.
b3e6c7ab-f01a-40f1-a059-5cf8ec2e0046 Stir in the uncooked rice, celery, diced turkey, poultry seasoning, and dried onion.
b3e6c7ab-f01a-40f1-a059-5cf8ec2e0046 Cover and cook on high for about 2 1/2 to 3 hours or on low for about 5 hours.
b3e6c7ab-f01a-40f1-a059-5cf8ec2e0046 About 20 to 30 minutes before the dish is done and the rice is just tenderit will be mushy if cooked too longthaw the vegetables in a colander under cold running water.
b3e6c7ab-f01a-40f1-a059-5cf8ec2e0046 Add the vegetables to the rice and turkey mixture.
b3e6c7ab-f01a-40f1-a059-5cf8ec2e0046 If desired, top with some shredded cheese and continue cooking for 20 to 30 minutes.
b3e6c7ab-f01a-40f1-a059-5cf8ec2e0046 Serve and enjoy!
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Gather the ingredients.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 With your fingers, separate the skin from breast meat.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Combine the parsley, thyme, butter, and lemon zest.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Rub turkey with the herb mixture all over and under the skin. Tie the skin back in place with kitchen twine.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Arrange the apples, carrots, and leeks in the bottom of the crockery insert of a 5- to 7-quart slow cooker.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Top with turkey breast, skin side up. Drizzle the lemon juice over the turkey.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Cover and cook on high for 1 hour. Continue cooking on low for 6 to 7 hours or on high for about 3 hours longer. According to the USDA guidelines, poultry must reach at least 165 F on a food thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the meat. Check with a reliable instant-read food thermometer.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Transfer the turkey breast to a serving platter and keep warm.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 If desired, brown the skin under the broiler for about 4 to 5 minutes. Let turkey breast stand for 10 minutes before slicing.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Turn the slow cooker to HIGH. Whisk broth and wine into the juices in the slow cooker.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 In a small bowl or cup, combine the butter and flour until the flour is well incorporated and the mixture is smooth.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Whisk the flour and butter combination into the slow cooker liquids and cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally until thickened and bubbly, about 15 minutes. Cook and stir for another minute.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Alternatively, you can cook the broth, wine, and juices in a saucepan on the stovetop more quickly. Add the butter and flour mixture and cook over medium heat, stirring, until thickened, about 2 to 3 minutes.
bd73b8cf-7ba3-4200-9c83-b9ce6610cbf3 Pour the sauce into a serving dish and spoon over slices of the turkey breast.
a09cf7ae-4085-4640-8692-95a2f6dddf43 Gather the ingredients.
a09cf7ae-4085-4640-8692-95a2f6dddf43 Put turkey cutlets between sheets of plastic wrap and gently pound to about 1/2-inch thickness.
a09cf7ae-4085-4640-8692-95a2f6dddf43 In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons of butter with 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
a09cf7ae-4085-4640-8692-95a2f6dddf43 Put 3 tablespoons of the flour in a wide shallow bowl or plate. Dredge the turkey cutlets in the flour, then saute 2 to 3 cutlets for about 3 to 4 minutes on each side, until browned and cooked through. Repeat with the remaining cutlets.
a09cf7ae-4085-4640-8692-95a2f6dddf43 Remove browned cutlets to a plate and keep warm.
a09cf7ae-4085-4640-8692-95a2f6dddf43 Add the chicken broth, lemon juice, and wine to the skillet and bring to a boil.
a09cf7ae-4085-4640-8692-95a2f6dddf43 In a small bowl or cup, combine the remaining 1 tablespoon of flour with the remaining 1 tablespoon of soft butter; stir until the mixture is smooth.
a09cf7ae-4085-4640-8692-95a2f6dddf43 Whisk the butter and flour mixture into the broth and lemon juice mixture and simmer for 2 minutes. Add the capers and parsley.
a09cf7ae-4085-4640-8692-95a2f6dddf43 Pour the sauce over the turkey cutlets.
a09cf7ae-4085-4640-8692-95a2f6dddf43 Serve and enjoy!
c0245442-e079-4d31-b4ac-0b6acdf064e5 Gather the ingredients.
c0245442-e079-4d31-b4ac-0b6acdf064e5 Spray inside of slow-cooker crock with nonstick cooking spray.
c0245442-e079-4d31-b4ac-0b6acdf064e5 In a bowl, combine the water, soup, mushrooms with liquid, and pimiento.
c0245442-e079-4d31-b4ac-0b6acdf064e5 Stir in the turkey, cheese, onion, parsley, and nutmeg.
c0245442-e079-4d31-b4ac-0b6acdf064e5 Add broken up spaghetti. Stir to combine and pour into crockpot.
c0245442-e079-4d31-b4ac-0b6acdf064e5 Cover and cook on low for 4 to 6 hours, until spaghetti is tender.
c0245442-e079-4d31-b4ac-0b6acdf064e5 Stir before serving.
39166fa4-891b-4f42-a254-4d19bc19a080 Gather the ingredients.
39166fa4-891b-4f42-a254-4d19bc19a080 Place the turkey breast in the pot you are going to fry it in. Add enough water to cover the breast with about 3 inches to spare. Remove the breast and measure the water. This is how much oil you will need.
39166fa4-891b-4f42-a254-4d19bc19a080 Dump out water and dry the pan well with paper towels.
39166fa4-891b-4f42-a254-4d19bc19a080 Pat dry the trussed breast dry with paper towels and coat all over with Cajun turkey seasoning. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside for 15 to 20 minutes.
39166fa4-891b-4f42-a254-4d19bc19a080 Meanwhile, heat oil to 350 F. The temperature is important, so use a thermometer to test. VERY SLOWLY, lower the seasoned breast into the hot oil. Use heat-resistant gloves to protect yourself from splashing.
39166fa4-891b-4f42-a254-4d19bc19a080 Fry breast to 3 minutes per pound plus 5 extra minutes. Therefore a 3-pound breast will take 14 minutes ((3 X 3) + 5 = 14). The internal temperature of the thickest part of turkey breast should be at least 170 to 175 F.
39166fa4-891b-4f42-a254-4d19bc19a080 Carefully remove from oil and place onto a paper towel lined cutting board. Allow breast to drain for 5 to 7 minutes.
39166fa4-891b-4f42-a254-4d19bc19a080 Carve into 1/2-inch slices and serve with your favorite sides.
39166fa4-891b-4f42-a254-4d19bc19a080 Enjoy!
c88fd179-cb07-49ef-bf87-5463b40c9a01 Gather the ingredients and preheat the oven to 425 F.
c88fd179-cb07-49ef-bf87-5463b40c9a01 Line the unbaked crust with parchment paper or foil and fill it with dried beans or pie weights.
c88fd179-cb07-49ef-bf87-5463b40c9a01 Bake the lined crust for about 15 minutes, or until the edges are browned. Remove the crust to a cooling rack and carefully remove the pie weights and paper or foil. Reduce the oven temperature to 375 F.
c88fd179-cb07-49ef-bf87-5463b40c9a01 Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium-low heat, melt the butter. Add a few tablespoons of water along with the broccoli and onion and cook, stirring, until tender. Drain well.
c88fd179-cb07-49ef-bf87-5463b40c9a01 Sprinkle broccoli and onion, turkey, and cheese into the partially-baked pie shell.
c88fd179-cb07-49ef-bf87-5463b40c9a01 In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs until slightly beaten. Whisk in the half-and-half, curry powder, and salt.
c88fd179-cb07-49ef-bf87-5463b40c9a01 Pour the egg mixture over turkey and broccoli mixture.
c88fd179-cb07-49ef-bf87-5463b40c9a01 Place the quiche on a baking sheet and carefully move it to the oven.
c88fd179-cb07-49ef-bf87-5463b40c9a01 Bake the quiche at 375 F for about 35 minutes, or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean.
c88fd179-cb07-49ef-bf87-5463b40c9a01 Serve and enjoy!
70b9c0e5-1423-40f3-a2df-a8c606dfdfa1 Gather the ingredients.
70b9c0e5-1423-40f3-a2df-a8c606dfdfa1 Preheat the oven to 325 F. Place a rack in a large open roasting pan.
70b9c0e5-1423-40f3-a2df-a8c606dfdfa1 Clean the turkey inside and out. Sprinkle the cavity with salt and pepper and place on the rack, breast side up.
70b9c0e5-1423-40f3-a2df-a8c606dfdfa1 Cut the orange, apple, and onion into large chunks and stuff into the turkey cavity. Tie the legs together with twine. Sprinkle the turkey all over with salt and pepper.
70b9c0e5-1423-40f3-a2df-a8c606dfdfa1 In a small bowl, combine the butter and dried herbs.
70b9c0e5-1423-40f3-a2df-a8c606dfdfa1 Using your hand, separate the skin from the breasts and push most of the butter mixture evenly under the skin on each side. Rub the turkey all over with any remaining butter mixture.
70b9c0e5-1423-40f3-a2df-a8c606dfdfa1 In a small saucepan, combine the maple syrup, brown sugar, and cider. Simmer over low heat until sugar is dissolved. Set aside.
70b9c0e5-1423-40f3-a2df-a8c606dfdfa1 Wrap the wing tips and drumstick ends with small pieces of foil. Loosely tent the turkey with a large piece of foil.
70b9c0e5-1423-40f3-a2df-a8c606dfdfa1 Roast for 2 1/2 hours, then remove and discard the foil tent and baste with the maple mixture. Continue roasting, basting frequently, for about 1 hour longer, or until a meat thermometer registers about 180 F when inserted in the thickest part of the turkey thigh or 170 F in the breast. The minimum safe temperature for poultry is 165 F.
70b9c0e5-1423-40f3-a2df-a8c606dfdfa1 Serve and enjoy!
f97509e2-7f24-4cf5-994f-a8990fd252a2 Gather the ingredients. Preheat oven to 375 F.
f97509e2-7f24-4cf5-994f-a8990fd252a2 Grease a jelly-roll pan or a 9-by-13-by-2-inch baking pan.
f97509e2-7f24-4cf5-994f-a8990fd252a2 Using the flat side of a meat mallet or rolling pin, gently pound cutlets between sheets of plastic wrap to thin slightly.
f97509e2-7f24-4cf5-994f-a8990fd252a2 Lightly sprinkle both sides of the cutlets with salt and pepper.
f97509e2-7f24-4cf5-994f-a8990fd252a2 Put the flour in a wide, shallow bowl and set aside.
f97509e2-7f24-4cf5-994f-a8990fd252a2 In a food processor or chopper, pulse the breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, parsley, and basil together until the crumbs are fine. Pour the breadcrumb mixture into a pie plate or shallow bowl.
f97509e2-7f24-4cf5-994f-a8990fd252a2 In another bowl, whisk together the mustard and eggs.
f97509e2-7f24-4cf5-994f-a8990fd252a2 Dip cutlets in the flour to coat, followed by the egg mixture. Then, coat them with the breadcrumb mixture.
f97509e2-7f24-4cf5-994f-a8990fd252a2 Place the breaded cutlets in the prepared baking dish.
f97509e2-7f24-4cf5-994f-a8990fd252a2 Bake the cutlets for 20 to 25 minutes, depending on thickness, or until turkey is no longer pink inside. The minimum safe temperature for poultry is 165 F. If in doubt, check them with an instant-read thermometer.
65c9b2c8-d95f-405c-a3d0-f9cad7eaef16 Gather the ingredients.
65c9b2c8-d95f-405c-a3d0-f9cad7eaef16 With a sharp knife, poke 1/2-inch-deep holes scattered evenly over the surface of the leg of lamb. Insert the garlic clove sticks into the holes.
65c9b2c8-d95f-405c-a3d0-f9cad7eaef16 Mix the olive oil, sea salt, rosemary, thyme, sage, and black pepper together for the marinade.
65c9b2c8-d95f-405c-a3d0-f9cad7eaef16 Rub the surface of the meat with the herb paste and place the leg of lamb into a large Dutch oven. Carefully pour the white wine into the side of the pan, avoiding pouring the wine over the meat itself, to keep the herb marinade in place. Refrigerate the leg of lamb for 2 hours, turning once every 30 minutes.
65c9b2c8-d95f-405c-a3d0-f9cad7eaef16 Preheat the oven to 275 F. Add 1 cup of water to the lamb and marinade. Place the Dutch oven into the preheated oven and cook the lamb, covered, for 3 hours, basting with the pan juices occasionally.
65c9b2c8-d95f-405c-a3d0-f9cad7eaef16 Sprinkle the leeks, celery root, carrots, turnips, onions, and garlic with salt and pepper. Uncover the pan and place the vegetables around the sides of the lamb.
65c9b2c8-d95f-405c-a3d0-f9cad7eaef16 Continue roasting the leg of lamb and vegetables for 4 hours, uncovered and basting occasionally, until the meat easily falls off the bone.
65c9b2c8-d95f-405c-a3d0-f9cad7eaef16 Remove the roast leg of lamb and vegetables to a serving platter and allow it to rest for 15 minutes.
65c9b2c8-d95f-405c-a3d0-f9cad7eaef16 While the roast lamb is resting, taste the pan juices and reduce them by simmering for a few minutes on the stovetop, if necessary.
65c9b2c8-d95f-405c-a3d0-f9cad7eaef16 Serve the lamb leg and vegetables, sliced or shredded, with the warm pan juices.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Gather the ingredients.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Choose the sauté setting on the Instant Pot and add the lamb and onions. Cook, stirring, until the meat is no longer pink. Add the garlic, rosemary, and parsley and sauté for about 1 minute longer.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Cancel the sauté and add the carrots and beef stock to the Instant Pot.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Put the potatoes in a steamer basket and place it on top of the lamb and carrot mixture.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Lock the Instant Pot lid in place and turn the venting knob to "sealing." Select the manual setting, high pressure. Set the time to 3 minutes.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 When the time is up, carefully turn the knob to "venting" for a quick release of pressure. The steam is very hot, so protect your hands and use a long wooden spoon handle or tongs to turn the knob.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Remove the potatoes to a large mixing bowl and set aside. Add the peas and gravy mix the Instant Pot. Set the pot on sauté and cook until the filling is thickened.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Meanwhile, mash the potatoes with 2 tablespoons of butter and the milk. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Preheat the broiler. Pour the thickened filling into a 1 1/2-quart baking dish.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Spoon the mashed potatoes evenly over the filling and gently spread them to cover. Alternatively, pipe the potatoes onto the filling with a pastry bag and large star tip. Melt the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter and brush it lightly over the potatoes. Sprinkle lightly with paprika.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Place the shepherd's pie under the preheated broiler and cook just until the potatoes are browned.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Serve the shepherd's pie with a salad or sliced fresh tomatoes on the side.
00b3145a-85ea-40c5-bf7c-bd8d867f1fd4 Enjoy!
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d Gather the ingredients.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d Preheat the oven to 300 F.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d Put 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the sliced onions in a heavy Dutch oven or stew pot over medium heat.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d Cook the onions, stirring frequently, until lightly browned. Remove to a plate.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d Add the remaining olive oil and the chopsin batches, if necessaryand cook, turning until nicely browned on both sides, about 3 to 4 minutes on each side.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d Add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d Add the onions back to the pot with the lamb and garlic.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d In a bowl or 2-cup measuring cup, combine the dry red wine with the mustard, salt, pepper, and rosemary. Blend well with spoon or whisk.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d Pour over the lamb mixture.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d If the pot isn't oven-safe, move everything to a large baking pan or casserole. Cover the pot or pan tightly with a lid or foil.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d Braise in the oven for 2 to 3 hours, or until the lamb chops are very tender.
5b39162c-b13b-4808-a0c7-68150bb85a3d Serve the lamb chops with the cooking juices, mashed potatoes, and cabbage, or another side vegetable, along with warm biscuits or a loaf of hearty bread.
84e1df4a-eafa-42e6-acab-cced2584feed Cut the meat into approximately 2-inch cubes.
84e1df4a-eafa-42e6-acab-cced2584feed Mix the vinegar with the garlic, cumin, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, and some salt and black pepper, and pour over the meat. Let meat marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes to an hour.
84e1df4a-eafa-42e6-acab-cced2584feed Purée the cilantro (stems removed) with some water in a blender or food processor until you get a smooth paste.
84e1df4a-eafa-42e6-acab-cced2584feed Heat 3-4 tablespoons oil in a large pot or skillet on high heat. Working in 2 batches, brown the meat on all sides. Remove meat to a plate.
84e1df4a-eafa-42e6-acab-cced2584feed Lower the heat and add the onion and aji pepper to the same skillet with the leftover marinade. Cook until soft and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
84e1df4a-eafa-42e6-acab-cced2584feed Add the meat back to the skillet, along with the beer, the cilantro, and 1 cup of the chicken stock. Cover and cook over low heat until the meat is tender, about an hour.
84e1df4a-eafa-42e6-acab-cced2584feed Peel and quarter the potatoes, and add them to the stew. Continue to cook over low heat until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes more, adding more chicken broth if necessary.
84e1df4a-eafa-42e6-acab-cced2584feed Serve warm over rice.
277a4dc0-a77d-4105-b337-22c470e7b8a3 Gather the ingredients.
277a4dc0-a77d-4105-b337-22c470e7b8a3 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
277a4dc0-a77d-4105-b337-22c470e7b8a3 In a large bowl, combine the ground lamb, egg, garlic, ground cumin, ground coriander, smoked paprika, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
277a4dc0-a77d-4105-b337-22c470e7b8a3 Place the mixture into an oiled 9 x 5-inch loaf pan and cook in the oven for approximately 30 minutes or until the top is a light golden brown.
277a4dc0-a77d-4105-b337-22c470e7b8a3 You can slice the loaf immediately if you like but, for best results, cool completely, wrap in aluminum foil, and refrigerate until firm.
277a4dc0-a77d-4105-b337-22c470e7b8a3 To reheat, add a little olive oil to a large skillet, slice the loaf very thinly and crisp up the slices in the hot pan for a few minutes.
277a4dc0-a77d-4105-b337-22c470e7b8a3 Assemble the sandwiches with pita, warmed and toasted through. Spread on some tzatziki or tahini sauce, add lettuce, tomato, cucumber, onion, and top with more sauce.
277a4dc0-a77d-4105-b337-22c470e7b8a3 Serve and enjoy.
487df70f-2ebd-45fc-8dbd-5ea1677fd083 Gather the ingredients.
487df70f-2ebd-45fc-8dbd-5ea1677fd083 Begin by forming your lamb patties.
487df70f-2ebd-45fc-8dbd-5ea1677fd083 You can either cook it on a cast-iron skillet or you can cook it on the grill. Either way, get the heat source blazing hot.
487df70f-2ebd-45fc-8dbd-5ea1677fd083 Add your burger sphere, let it cook for a few minutes until the bottom becomes crispy and cooked about halfway up the meat.
487df70f-2ebd-45fc-8dbd-5ea1677fd083 At this point, flip the burger gently, and then brown the other side for a minute or two.
487df70f-2ebd-45fc-8dbd-5ea1677fd083 Next, you'll want to take a spatula and smush the burger. The grilled bits will help the burger stay together and will taste amazing. Continue cooking until the meat is cooked through and set aside to let it rest.
487df70f-2ebd-45fc-8dbd-5ea1677fd083 Then, toast your bun. Do this either directly on the grill, in a toaster, or using a broiler.
487df70f-2ebd-45fc-8dbd-5ea1677fd083 Once the bun is crispy and warm, smear half the tzatziki onto both halves. On the bottom half, add the lamb burger, then the roasted tomatoes, then the red onion, and the mint. Serve immediately.
eb310c77-534c-465e-916e-39dccecf92f3 Use a meat mallet to gently flatten the lamb chops slightly.
eb310c77-534c-465e-916e-39dccecf92f3 Put the garlic, ginger, onion, poppy seeds, cinnamon, cloves, green chilies, coriander, turmeric, and salt into a clean, dry blender/food processor. Grind into a smooth paste. Keep this paste aside for later use.
eb310c77-534c-465e-916e-39dccecf92f3 Take a large skillet or heavy-bottomed pan and add 3 tbsps of oil to it. Heat on medium. Add the lamb chops to it and fry until browned on each side. This should take 5 to 7 minutes on each side.
eb310c77-534c-465e-916e-39dccecf92f3 While you are frying the lamb chops, set up another heavy-bottomed pan on medium heat. Add the remaining cooking oil to it. When the oil is hot, add the previously prepared green masala to it. Fry well for at least 10 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent the masala from burning or sticking.
eb310c77-534c-465e-916e-39dccecf92f3 When the masala has been fried well, add the browned lamb chops to it. Stir well to coat the chops well with the masala.
eb310c77-534c-465e-916e-39dccecf92f3 Season with salt if required and add 1/2 a cup of hot water. Bring the whole mixture to a boil and then simmer the heat. Cover the pan and cook until the meat is tender and most of the liquid has dried up. When this happens, turn off heat.
eb310c77-534c-465e-916e-39dccecf92f3 Serve Chops Hara Masala with small potatoes. Add a green, leafy salad for a wholesome, delicious meal!
1d56947c-16c3-4331-a54b-6817f02fbe6e Toss the lamb cubes with a few tablespoons of flour; shake off excess.
1d56947c-16c3-4331-a54b-6817f02fbe6e Melt the butter with the vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven or stockpot over medium heat. Add the floured lamb cubes and cook until browned on all sides, stirring and turning frequently.
1d56947c-16c3-4331-a54b-6817f02fbe6e Remove the meat and add the mushrooms to the drippings. Cook until the mushrooms are golden brown and tender, stirring frequently. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer.
1d56947c-16c3-4331-a54b-6817f02fbe6e Add the lamb cubes back to the pot along with the water, broth, 1 teaspoon of salt, thyme, and pepper; cover and simmer for 1 hour. Skim off any fat on the surface.
1d56947c-16c3-4331-a54b-6817f02fbe6e Add the potatoes and onion; cover and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 15 to 20 minutes.
1d56947c-16c3-4331-a54b-6817f02fbe6e Add peas, if using, and simmer for 5 more minutes.
1d56947c-16c3-4331-a54b-6817f02fbe6e Combine the milk and 1/3 cup of flour in a cup or small bowl; whisk until smooth. Add the mixture to the simmering stew and cook for about 1 to 2 minutes longer, or until thickened.
