1d56947c-16c3-4331-a54b-6817f02fbe6e Taste and adjust seasonings with more salt and pepper, as needed.
23c2fc03-573b-4d31-8a65-5cc94f6dcd1b Gather the ingredients.
23c2fc03-573b-4d31-8a65-5cc94f6dcd1b In a large bowl, combine the ground lamb, minced onion and garlic, 1 teaspoon each of the ground cumin and sumac, salt, ground black pepper, red pepper flakes, and ice water.
23c2fc03-573b-4d31-8a65-5cc94f6dcd1b Knead the mixture by hand until it turns tacky and starts sticking to the side of the bowl. Place in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to chill.
23c2fc03-573b-4d31-8a65-5cc94f6dcd1b Wet your hands and place a quarter of the lamb mixture onto each skewer. One easy way is to use a 1-ounce scoop to form balls, thread them onto the skewer, then mash them together.
23c2fc03-573b-4d31-8a65-5cc94f6dcd1b In a small bowl, combine the remaining 1/2 teaspoon each of ground cumin and sumac.
23c2fc03-573b-4d31-8a65-5cc94f6dcd1b Grill the kebabs for approximately 12 minutes, until well charred on both sides. Sprinkle the spice mix over the kebabs while they are cooking.
23c2fc03-573b-4d31-8a65-5cc94f6dcd1b Serve the kebabs on warm pita or naan bread with sliced red onions, parsley, tomatoes, and diced cucumbers. Enjoy!
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Gather the ingredients.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Heat oven to 375 F.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Using a pastry brush, coat the interior surfaces of both halves of a seasoned lamb cake mold with solid vegetable shortening, making sure you get into all the crevices.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Place halves on a baking sheet, open-side up, and heat for 20 minutes.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Remove from the oven and let cool completely. Pour off any excess shortening. Reduce heat to 350 F.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Prepare pound cake mix according to box instructions.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Place the front-half of the mold on a baking sheet and fill with batter to the lip, 1/4-inch from the top.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Submerge a toothpick in the batter in each ear to reinforce them.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Place the back-half of the mold on top of the front.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Place in oven and bake about 1 hour or until a skewer inserted into the vent holes of the lamb come out clean.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Remove from oven and place on cooling rack for 15 minutes.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Carefully remove the back end of the mold, inserting a knife between the mold edges if they are stuck together. Allow cooling for an additional 5 minutes.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Place another rack on the lamb cake and carefully flip it over and remove the front half of the mold. Let lamb cake cool completely lying on its back.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Place a dab of cream cheese frosting on an oblong platter and set the lamb on top to secure it.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Frost all sides of lamb, swirling it to represent lamb's wool.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Wrap a narrow red ribbon around the lamb's neck. Use raisins for eyes and nose, cutting them in half if necessary to make them more proportional.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Place coconut and green food coloring in a zip-top back and shake it, to color the coconut. Place green "grass" around the lamb.
640c138f-7f2f-4dcf-91d9-0d1119461c2e Serve for Easter and enjoy!
bbcbe3c5-b2f2-46fb-b871-c4051c305a51 Gather the ingredients.
bbcbe3c5-b2f2-46fb-b871-c4051c305a51 Preheat pan or grill to 375 F.
bbcbe3c5-b2f2-46fb-b871-c4051c305a51 In a bowl, combine lamb, parsley, salt, pepper, and paprika and mix well. (Roll up the sleeves, take off your rings, and do this by hand. The results are better this way.)
bbcbe3c5-b2f2-46fb-b871-c4051c305a51 Form meat and spice mixture into 4 patties -- 1/2 to 3/4 inches thick.
bbcbe3c5-b2f2-46fb-b871-c4051c305a51 Put in heated pan or grill and cook for about 4 to 5 minutes each side. The flavor of lamb is best at a medium-well, so cook until you see a faint pink color in the center. You can certainly cook longer, should you choose.
bbcbe3c5-b2f2-46fb-b871-c4051c305a51 Place desired cheese on top and allow it to melt for about 30 seconds to one minute.
bbcbe3c5-b2f2-46fb-b871-c4051c305a51 Splash the pan with some cool water to create steam and put a stainless steel mixing bowl over the pan for about 30 seconds. The result is a perfectly melted cheese that hugs the burger.
bbcbe3c5-b2f2-46fb-b871-c4051c305a51 Serve and enjoy!
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 Over medium heat, brown the lamb in 2 tablespoons of olive oil, using a fork to separate the meat out into small pieces. (Note: because ground lamb is softer than ground beef, take care not to mash it when breaking it up.)
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 When meat is browned just to the point where it doesn't look red, transfer to a colander and drain.
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 Over medium heat, sauté chopped onion in 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 When the onion turns translucent, stir in drained lamb, tomatoes, 1/2 cup of water, celery, bay leaf, 1 rounded teaspoon of sea salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper.
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 When it reaches a boil, cover and reduce heat to a simmer, cooking for 20 minutes.
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 Taste and add more salt and pepper to your preference.
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 In a saucepan, bring chicken broth or stock to a boil.
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C).
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 Remove bay leaf, and transfer the meat mixture to a greased baking or oven-safe casserole dish.
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 Add boiling stock or broth and stir in the pasta.
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 Cook uncovered in the oven at 390 F / 200 C for about 40 minutes, until the pasta is done and almost the liquid has been absorbed. Stir once or twice during cooking.
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 Remove pot from the oven and cover with a cotton towel for 20 minutes (to absorb excess moisture).
5132da4c-af9c-4327-bb04-c5122a7ce609 Stir in the fresh parsley just before serving, and add an optional topping of grated cheese.
92a05948-6409-4c78-b300-2dd807cb5cb1 Gather the ingredients.
92a05948-6409-4c78-b300-2dd807cb5cb1 Trim the fat from the lamb chops then cut the meat into 1-inch pieces. Place the meat and bones in a stock pot or Dutch oven; barely cover the meat with about 1 1/4 cups water. Cover the pan and simmer for 45 minutes (do not boil).
92a05948-6409-4c78-b300-2dd807cb5cb1 Add the potato, carrots, onion, celery, green pepper, and optional rutabaga with salt and pepper to the meat in the Dutch oven.
92a05948-6409-4c78-b300-2dd807cb5cb1 Cover and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, until meat and vegetables are tender.
92a05948-6409-4c78-b300-2dd807cb5cb1 Using tongs, remove the bones to a bowl and discard.
92a05948-6409-4c78-b300-2dd807cb5cb1 Remove the Dutch oven from the heat.
92a05948-6409-4c78-b300-2dd807cb5cb1 Mix the flour and cold water. Stir the mixture into the stew. Return to heat. Cook, stirring until the stew is thickened.
92a05948-6409-4c78-b300-2dd807cb5cb1 Add the chopped parsley and taste and adjust the seasonings.
92a05948-6409-4c78-b300-2dd807cb5cb1 Serve the stew hot.
44bf5765-7b05-4d3d-a998-77144e91a20a Thoroughly mix all ingredients together.
44bf5765-7b05-4d3d-a998-77144e91a20a Shape into 4 oblong patties about 5 inches long and 3/4 inch thick and place on a small baking sheet. Cover with plastic and refrigerate for at least 1/2 hour.
44bf5765-7b05-4d3d-a998-77144e91a20a Get the grill hot, oil it, and grill kebabs for about 4 minutes per side.
44bf5765-7b05-4d3d-a998-77144e91a20a I serve these with plain yogurt for dipping and tabbouleh on the side. You can also make these a day in advance. If you make them in advance, simply wrap in tin foil and warm in a 200dg Fahrenheit oven for 25 minutes until warmed through
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Gather the ingredients.
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Pre-heat oven to 220 C/ 425 F Gas 7.
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Place the flour, butter , lard and salt into a food processor. Mix on a pulse setting until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs, add the water, slowly, through the funnel until the dough comes together in a ball. Wrap in clingfilm or plastic wrap and rest the pastry for 30 minutes.
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Meanwhile, melt the butter in a saucepan, add the leeks and cook on a low heat for 5 minutes.
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Add the potato chunks to the pan and cook for another 5 minutes.
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Add the lamb pieces and brown all over, cook for two minutes, cover with a lid and cook over a low heat for 6 minutes. Season the contents of the pan with salt and pepper and leave to one side to cool.
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Divide the pastry into 2 and roll each piece into rounds approx 22cm. Brush the rounds with beaten egg.
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Divide the meat mixture between each pastry circle and place to one side of the circle. Brush the edges with a little more beaten egg.
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Fold the circle in half over the filling so the two edges meet. Crimp the two edges together to create a tight seal. Brush each pasty all over with the remaining beaten egg.
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Place the pasties on a greased baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes, then reduce the heat to 180 °C and cook for a further 30 until the Oggie is golden brown.
1f8da765-7751-4af8-a23a-684d1e66a3c8 Serve hot or cold. Delicious with pickled onions, tomatoes and chutney, or if hot, with a little warm gravy and peas.
fea6c0de-f3ac-4340-8186-3a721d96f895 Gather the ingredients.
fea6c0de-f3ac-4340-8186-3a721d96f895 Cut the lamb into thin strips. Combine with the marinade ingredients. Marinate the lamb for 25 minutes, then drain and reserve the marinade.
fea6c0de-f3ac-4340-8186-3a721d96f895 While the lamb is marinating, prepare the sauce and other ingredients. In a small bowl, combine the sauce ingredients. Set aside.
fea6c0de-f3ac-4340-8186-3a721d96f895 Heat the wok over medium-high to high heat. Add 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. When the oil is hot, add the garlic. Stir-fry until aromatic, about 30 seconds.
fea6c0de-f3ac-4340-8186-3a721d96f895 Add the lamb. Stir-fry very briefly, until the lamb changes color, 1 to 2 minutes.
fea6c0de-f3ac-4340-8186-3a721d96f895 Add the reserved marinade and bring to a boil.
fea6c0de-f3ac-4340-8186-3a721d96f895 Stir in the scallions. Taste and season with salt and pepper if desired.
fea6c0de-f3ac-4340-8186-3a721d96f895 Remove from the heat, stir in the sesame oil, and serve.
bf70a39e-576f-4396-b73c-534e3542124e Gather the ingredients.
bf70a39e-576f-4396-b73c-534e3542124e Place the raisins and prunes into a small bowl and pour over enough water to cover. Add lemon juice and let soak for at least 1 hour. Drain. Roughly chop the prunes.
bf70a39e-576f-4396-b73c-534e3542124e Meanwhile, heat the butter in a large pan, add the onion, and cook for 5 minutes. Add cubed lamb, ground lamb, and crushed garlic cloves. Fry for 5 minutes, stirring constantly until browned.
bf70a39e-576f-4396-b73c-534e3542124e Pour 2/3 cup/150 ml of stock into the pan. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat, cover, and simmer for 1 hour, or until the lamb is tender.
bf70a39e-576f-4396-b73c-534e3542124e Add the remaining stock and bring to a boil. Add rinsed long-grain white rice and a large pinch of saffron. Stir, then cover, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until the rice is tender.
bf70a39e-576f-4396-b73c-534e3542124e Add the drained raisins, drained chopped prunes, and salt and pepper to taste. Heat through for a few minutes, then turn out onto a warmed serving dish and garnish with sprigs of flat-leaf parsley.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Gather the ingredients.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Heat the oven to 350 F. Cut the white and sweet potatoes into 1-inch-thick slices.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Cut the onions in half and then place all of the vegetables in a roasting pan in one even layer.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Drizzle the vegetables with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt and toss to combine.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Place the lamb on top of the vegetables and rub the lamb with the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Sprinkle the lamb with the rest of the sea salt.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Use the point of a sharp knife to make small incisions all over the lamb.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Place the garlic slivers and rosemary springs in the slits.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Place the roasting pan on the middle oven rack and roast for 1 1/2 hours, or until a meat thermometer placed in the thickest part of the lamb reads 140 F for rare, 160 F for medium, and 170 F for well done.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Remove from the oven and transfer the lamb to a plate to rest.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Cover the lamb with aluminum foil and let it sit for 10 minutes.
5c0379b5-6ca8-46c9-bf74-1126a6b451cc Serve the lamb with the roasted potatoes and onions, and mint sauce on the side.
f7cea5e9-b8ba-4c5e-9549-b54d683f14c6 Cut the lamb into paper thin rectangular slices. Slice the bean curd.
f7cea5e9-b8ba-4c5e-9549-b54d683f14c6 Wash, drain, and chop the vegetables. Prepare any side dishes that you are planning to serve.
f7cea5e9-b8ba-4c5e-9549-b54d683f14c6 Lay the lamb, chopped vegetables, and side dishes on separate platters on the table. Place the dipping sauces on the table in small individual bowls. Make sure each guest has a complete place setting, including a dipping fork (color-coded if possible) and a small bowl for placing the cooked food.
f7cea5e9-b8ba-4c5e-9549-b54d683f14c6 Bring the broth with the dark soy sauce to a boil, and add the ginger and green onion. Transfer enough broth so that the fondue pot is approximately 2/3 - 3/4 full. (How much broth you need will depend on the size of the fondue pot).
f7cea5e9-b8ba-4c5e-9549-b54d683f14c6 Place the fondue pot on the burner, and keep it simmering throughout the meal. Keep the remaining broth warming on the stovetop.
f7cea5e9-b8ba-4c5e-9549-b54d683f14c6 To serve, invite guests to spear the food with a dipping fork and cook briefly in the broth until cooked, then dip the cooked food in the sauces as desired.
f7cea5e9-b8ba-4c5e-9549-b54d683f14c6 Use a dipping basket to cook the vegetables in batches in the hot broth and ladle out into the soup bowls. Cook the noodles and serve at the end of the meal.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Gather the ingredients.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Cut the lamb shoulder and fat into small pieces that will easily fit into your meat grinder, removing any sinew from the meat as you go.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a In a large bowl combine the meat and fat with the rosemary, salt, garlic, and pepper. Stir to mix. Cover and refrigerate 4 to 6 hours or overnight.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Before grinding, place the bowl from your stand mixer and meat grinder in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Remove the meat mixture, bowl, meat grinder, and wine from the refrigerator. Using the finest grind on your grinder, grind the meat mixture into the chilled bowl.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Alternate pushing the pieces of fat and meat through the grinder to ensure that the fat doesn't stick inside.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Using the paddle attachment on your stand mixer, mix the ground meat on low speed, adding the cold red wine. The mixture will come together in about 2 minutes and be sticky.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Take about 1 tablespoon and form a small patty. Fry it in a skillet. Taste and adjust the seasoning, adding more salt if desired. If you plan on stuffing the sausage into casings, refrigerate it for 2 hours.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Otherwise, you can simply shape and wrap the sausages in plastic wrap for later use. If you're stuffing the sausages, proceed to the next step.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a While the sausage meat is chilling, soak the casings in warm water for 1 hour.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Rinse the casings in cold water, then run water through them, by slipping one end of the casing over the tap and gently turn on the water to let it flow through the casing.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Place the casings in a fine-mesh sieve to drain. You want them to be moist when you fill them.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Attach the sausage stuffer to the grinder, and push the damp sausage casing over the tube until about 4 inches is hanging from the end and tie a knot in this piece. (If it's your first time at making sausage, ask a friend to help you with this step.)
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Add the chilled mixture to the grinder on low speed, and slowly stuff the sausage casings, trying to minimize the air pockets in the casings. As the sausage enters the casing, it should slowly slide off the tube.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Once all the mixture is used up, ease any remaining casing off the tube.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Roll the sausage on a damp surface to distribute the filling as evenly as possible, then form the sausage into links by twisting the casings at 6-inch intervals.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Twist each link in the opposite direction to prevent them from unwinding.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Cover the sausages, and refrigerate for up to 3 days or freeze them.
ea98798b-8ff9-426f-9cfc-8bc67a600e1a Enjoy!
fe771fc0-a3ee-47b3-b1db-a1bacd252ac8 Heat the oven to 350 F. Grease a 2-quart casserole dish. Gather the ingredients.
fe771fc0-a3ee-47b3-b1db-a1bacd252ac8 In a skillet, melt the butter and cook the onion until tender. Add the mushrooms and saute until lightly browned.
fe771fc0-a3ee-47b3-b1db-a1bacd252ac8 In a large bowl, add the cooked and diced lamb, cooked rice, undrained tomatoes, salt, pepper, curry powder, and sautéed onions and mushrooms with their cooking liquid. Mix gently to combine.
fe771fc0-a3ee-47b3-b1db-a1bacd252ac8 Turn the mixture out into the greased casserole dish. Top with the grated cheese.
fe771fc0-a3ee-47b3-b1db-a1bacd252ac8 Bake for 30 minutes, or until hot and bubbly. Serve hot.
d1b9f7bd-39ce-4d73-bf42-d0ed91585760 Gather the ingredients.
d1b9f7bd-39ce-4d73-bf42-d0ed91585760 In a large bowl, mix together ground beef, ground pork, ground lamb, garlic, onions, salt, and sweet or hot paprika until thoroughly combined. Do not overmix because this will toughen the meat.
d1b9f7bd-39ce-4d73-bf42-d0ed91585760 Refrigerate meat mixture for several hours for the flavors to meld and for the mixture to firm.
d1b9f7bd-39ce-4d73-bf42-d0ed91585760 Heat a grill, indoor grill, broiler or skillet. Using slightly dampened hands, divide meat mixture into 6 portions. Form into thin patties, 9 inches by 1/2 inch or about the size of a small dinner plate.
d1b9f7bd-39ce-4d73-bf42-d0ed91585760 Cook pljeskavice about 7 minutes per side.
d1b9f7bd-39ce-4d73-bf42-d0ed91585760 Serve with green onions or chopped raw onion, tomatoes, ajvar, lepinje or pogacha bread and Serbian potato salad or coleslaw on the side. Some Serbs place the patty on a large bun like an American hamburger.
d1b9f7bd-39ce-4d73-bf42-d0ed91585760 Enjoy!
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Gather the ingredients.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Preheat the oven to 325 F.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Place a rack in a roasting pan.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Pat the lamb dry with paper towels. If there is a tough outer layer of fat on your roast, remove it with a sharp knife. Trim excess fat but leave some so you'll have rich drippings for gravy.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Peel the garlic. Cut 2 cloves of garlic into thin slivers. Mince the third clove of garlic and set aside.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c With a small, sharp knife, make several tiny, slitsabout 1/2-inch to 1-inch deepevenly over the surface of the roast. Insert the garlic slivers into the slits.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Rub the lamb all over with the lemon juice.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Give the rosemary and thyme a rough chop (or crumble dried rosemary).
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c In a small bowl, combine the minced garlic with the herbs, 1 teaspoon of kosher salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper. Rub the garlic and herb mixture over the surface of the lamb.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Place the roast, fat side up, on the rack in the prepared roasting pan.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Insert meat thermometer in the thickest part of the meat, not touching fat or bone. Roast in the preheated oven for about 25 to 30 minutes per pound, or until meat thermometer registers 145 F (medium rare) to 165 F (well done), depending on how well you like it done.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Remove the roast to a platter and let it rest for 15 minutes before carving.
3b43985f-3907-49bd-88ca-dfa28e39487c Serve and enjoy!
d6b876f7-d1a2-4f2a-9f3f-3b63f05fcf6f Gather the ingredients.
d6b876f7-d1a2-4f2a-9f3f-3b63f05fcf6f In a large bowl, mix together beef, pork, lamb, garlic, 1/2 cup chopped onions, and salt until thoroughly combined.
d6b876f7-d1a2-4f2a-9f3f-3b63f05fcf6f To make sure your seasonings are just right, make a small patty and fry it to taste test. Add more garlic, salt, or onions to suit your palate.
d6b876f7-d1a2-4f2a-9f3f-3b63f05fcf6f Refrigerate the meat mixture, ideally overnight, before forming.
d6b876f7-d1a2-4f2a-9f3f-3b63f05fcf6f To make the sausages by hand, roll the meat mixture into a long, 3/4-inch cylinder. Cut links at 4-inch intervals. If you prefer, you can use a sausage extruder without a casing attached.
d6b876f7-d1a2-4f2a-9f3f-3b63f05fcf6f Place the sausages on a plastic wrap-lined plate, cover with more plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour to firm. They now can be cooked.
d6b876f7-d1a2-4f2a-9f3f-3b63f05fcf6f Broil cevapcici on a charcoal grill or a heated oven broiler rack coated with cooking spray 4 to 6 inches from the flame, 4 minutes per side or until no longer pink in the middle. Or they can be pan-fried in a large skillet coated with cooking spray over high heat for a total of about 8 minutes, turning frequently to brown all sides.
d6b876f7-d1a2-4f2a-9f3f-3b63f05fcf6f Serve with chopped raw onion, Serbian potato salad, and pogacha bread.
f298f6a7-a9ed-4421-8e20-ee3f61fcda93 Gather the ingredients.
f298f6a7-a9ed-4421-8e20-ee3f61fcda93 Toast the cumin, fennel, coriander seeds in a dry skillet set over medium heat, constantly stirring, for about 2 minutes, until they become fragrant. Be very careful not to overcook, and worst still, burn the spices. If you leave them too long, this will happen, and you will need to throw them away and start again.
f298f6a7-a9ed-4421-8e20-ee3f61fcda93 Once toasted, allow the seeds to cool and then process them in a spice grinder.
f298f6a7-a9ed-4421-8e20-ee3f61fcda93 Add the toasted, ground seeds to the paprika, cayenne pepper, and cinnamon.
f298f6a7-a9ed-4421-8e20-ee3f61fcda93 Place the ground lamb in a large bowl, drizzle it with the olive oil, and sprinkle the spice mixture, chopped herbs, crushed garlic, and salt over the meat. Mix the seasonings into the meat.
f298f6a7-a9ed-4421-8e20-ee3f61fcda93 The seasoned meat can then be either formed into patties, the size and shape of your choice though avoid making them too big as they will be difficult to stuff into a sandwich. Or, fill bought sausage casings with the lamb sausage mixture. For this, you will need a sausage stuffer attachment often sold for stand mixers, or a stuffing machine.
f298f6a7-a9ed-4421-8e20-ee3f61fcda93 Once made, chill before using.
f298f6a7-a9ed-4421-8e20-ee3f61fcda93 Cook the patties or sausages according to your recipe, or simply fry until cooked right through.
f298f6a7-a9ed-4421-8e20-ee3f61fcda93 Serve stuffed into a bread bun, pita, or slice and serve in Middle Eastern Flatbreads and fresh salad.
68f4dea9-b7f4-4abe-a834-86c0603de31a Combine olive oil, thyme, basil, rosemary, garlic, lemon zest, salt and pepper in a bowl. Dip lamb chops into the mixture to coat evenly. Cover chops and refrigerate for as little as 30 minutes or for up to 4 hours.
68f4dea9-b7f4-4abe-a834-86c0603de31a Preheat grill for medium high heat.
68f4dea9-b7f4-4abe-a834-86c0603de31a Place chops on grill and cook for about 5 to 7 minutes per side or until temperature reaches between 145 to 155 F.
68f4dea9-b7f4-4abe-a834-86c0603de31a Once cooked to desired doneness, remove chops from grill. Tent with foil and let meat rest for 5 minutes. Serve with grilled vegetables or your favorite side dishes.
68f4dea9-b7f4-4abe-a834-86c0603de31a Enjoy!
6f8d92d6-dfb8-4aca-a461-4eb3afe28209 Preheat oven to 325 F.
6f8d92d6-dfb8-4aca-a461-4eb3afe28209 Salt the lamb on all sides.
6f8d92d6-dfb8-4aca-a461-4eb3afe28209 Heat a large, heavy skillet with enough oil to coat the bottom of the pan.
6f8d92d6-dfb8-4aca-a461-4eb3afe28209 When the oil shimmers, add the lamb and brown well on all sides.
6f8d92d6-dfb8-4aca-a461-4eb3afe28209 Use tongs to hold up the rack so you can sear the ends and top edges of the rack.
6f8d92d6-dfb8-4aca-a461-4eb3afe28209 Set the lamb aside on a rack placed in a baking sheet.
6f8d92d6-dfb8-4aca-a461-4eb3afe28209 About 20 minutes before serving, place the rack in the oven and cook until lamb reaches 140 F for medium rare.
6f8d92d6-dfb8-4aca-a461-4eb3afe28209 Remove from oven and let rest for five minutes before slicing into double chops.
023ecf31-0be7-4288-8bac-0bda383ed423 In the bowl with the lamb, add red onion, garlic, egg, bread crumbs, cumin, mayonnaise, fresh mint, and salt. Using your hands, mix thoroughly to distribute the ingredients evenly. With a teaspoon, form the mixture into 24 meatballs. Don't level the meat off or pack the meatballs too tightly.
023ecf31-0be7-4288-8bac-0bda383ed423 Preheat the broiler.
023ecf31-0be7-4288-8bac-0bda383ed423 Lightly spread canola oil on a baking sheet using a paper towel. Place the meatballs two inches apart on the baking sheet, and position the baking sheet four inches from the heat source.
023ecf31-0be7-4288-8bac-0bda383ed423 Broil for about five minutes, turning once halfway through.
023ecf31-0be7-4288-8bac-0bda383ed423 Arrange the meatballs on a serving platter, and squeeze fresh lemon juice over the top. Sprinkle the cayenne pepper over the meatballs at the last minute. Serve at once with tzatziki.
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Gather the ingredients.
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Add the lamb cubes and cook, turning frequently to brown all sides.
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Meanwhile, prepare the vegetables. Cut the turnips into 1/2-inch cubes.
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Peel the carrot and slice it into 1/2-inch thick rounds.
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Peel the onion and chop it coarsely.
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Quarter the potatoes (peel if desired.)
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Add the lamb to the slow cooker along with the salt, pepper, turnip, carrots, onions, and potatoes. Add 2 cups of water or stock. If you use regular stock or broth with salt, don't add until the end of the cooking time.
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Add 2 cups water and cook on low, covered, for 8 to 10 hours.
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Uncover and turn on high. Blend flour with 1/4 cup water until it forms a paste; slowly add it to the stew, stirring constantly until slightly thickened.
b11c9241-f136-4b04-8903-09703ee40545 Stir in parsley, and serve.
1be86ea4-f5d0-4f05-8981-5aa96da600bf Trim any visible fat from the lamb and cut it into bite-size pieces. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and then toss with the flour.
1be86ea4-f5d0-4f05-8981-5aa96da600bf Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oilor vegetable oilin a Dutch oven or large saucepan over medium heat. Add the floured lamb pieces and the chopped onion. Cook the lamb until browned on all sides, stirring frequently.
1be86ea4-f5d0-4f05-8981-5aa96da600bf Add the onion and cook, stirring, for about 5 minutes longer, or until the onion is translucent.
1be86ea4-f5d0-4f05-8981-5aa96da600bf Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute longer.
1be86ea4-f5d0-4f05-8981-5aa96da600bf Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil.
1be86ea4-f5d0-4f05-8981-5aa96da600bf Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about 1 hour, until lamb is tender.
1be86ea4-f5d0-4f05-8981-5aa96da600bf Serve over hot cooked rice, grits or polenta, or couscous, or serve with hot buttered noodles or potatoes.
26143d68-f774-4a9f-9c06-1bd77e43fbbf Mix together the breadcrumbs and milk in a large bowl and let sit for 20 minutes.
26143d68-f774-4a9f-9c06-1bd77e43fbbf Add the rest of the lamb meatball ingredients and mix with your hands until just combined.
26143d68-f774-4a9f-9c06-1bd77e43fbbf To test the seasoning, cook a small piece of the lamb mixture to check for salt and pepper. With damp hands, form into 24 small meatballs and place them on a lightly oiled baking sheet.
26143d68-f774-4a9f-9c06-1bd77e43fbbf Bake in a preheated 450 F oven for 15 minutes to brown.
26143d68-f774-4a9f-9c06-1bd77e43fbbf Transfer into a large saucepan and add the sauce ingredients. Bring to a simmer and cook covered, on low, for 1 hour. Stir occasionally. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve hot.
26143d68-f774-4a9f-9c06-1bd77e43fbbf These tasty lamb meatballs are delicious served over some lemon couscous.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Gather the ingredients.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 In a bowl, mix the lamb and yogurt and keep aside. This will tenderize the lamb.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Heat the oil in a deep pan and add the cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, bay leaves, and peppercorns. Fry till they turn slightly darker in color.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Now add the onions and fry until they turn light golden.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Add the ginger and garlic paste and fry for a minute.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Add the coriander, cumin, turmeric, Kashmiri chilies, and garam masala and fry until the oil separates from the masala.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Add the meat and yogurt mix to the masala and fry well.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Add the beef stock, water, and salt, to taste.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Cook till the gravy is reduced. Stir often. The gravy should be thick when done.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Whisk the cream until smooth.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Stir it into the curry to mix well.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Garnish with coriander leaves and serve with plain boiled rice or pulao and a vegetable side dish.
d6759018-0cb4-48a6-955b-9275fe6d3af1 Enjoy!
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Cutaway any excess fat from lamb leg. Rise and pat dry.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Combine marinade ingredients in a food processor.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Remove 1/4 cup/60 mL and set aside.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Apply remaining marinade liberally onto lamb leg.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Place into a deep dish, cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Meanwhile, prepare to baste. You can use some of this mixture to inject directly into the lamb before cooking.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Preheat grill for medium heat. This is best done with a drip pan underneath the lamb to prevent drippings from causing a flare-up.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Putting a bone-in leg of lamb on a rotisserie skewer can be a little challenging. A long thin knife or large metal skewer can be used to make a hole by starting at the bone end and working it through the thickest part of the leg. It is important to try to find the center to balance the leg of lamb on the rotisserie rod. Secure with the rotisserie forks tightly. It might be necessary to tie the leg with kitchen twine (see rotisserie cooking for more information).
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Place the leg of lamb on the grill, making sure it is properly centered and able to turn freely.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Place a drip pan under and add several cups of water to the pan.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Keep the grill on medium to medium-high heat. Water in the pan should not boil. If the grill has a rotisserie burner, you must use that only. However, If the grill doesn't have a rotisserie burner, but has more than two main burners, you must use the burners on either side for indirect grilling.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Grill lamb leg for about 20 to 30 minutes per pound.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Check the temperature in the thickest part of the meat, avoiding the bone. Once the lamb has reached an internal temperature above 145 F/65 C (or higher if desired), remove from heat and tent with aluminum foil for 10 to 12 minutes.
d2a41d0d-995a-417a-87d0-0fa09285549f Carve and serve.
5357aa3b-c993-4324-b3b9-ed8c0d2458d0 Gather the ingredients.
5357aa3b-c993-4324-b3b9-ed8c0d2458d0 In a large bowl, mix all ingredients together with your hands, squeezing and kneading to combine thoroughly.
5357aa3b-c993-4324-b3b9-ed8c0d2458d0 Pinch off a small piece, fry it, and taste to adjust seasonings.
5357aa3b-c993-4324-b3b9-ed8c0d2458d0 Form mixture into 4 sausage-shaped rolls about 1 inch in diameter and 4 to five inches long.
5357aa3b-c993-4324-b3b9-ed8c0d2458d0 Arrange on a lightly oiled platter or large plate, cover with plastic, and refrigerate for 2 to 8 hours.
5357aa3b-c993-4324-b3b9-ed8c0d2458d0 Build a hot fire, oil the grate, and cook, turning with a spatula, until browned and cooked through; 6 to 8 minutes.
5357aa3b-c993-4324-b3b9-ed8c0d2458d0 Serve immediately with mustard and enjoy!
4a8e35d4-2d54-4e00-b486-d1883fdf28af Trim the excess fat from the rack of lamb.
4a8e35d4-2d54-4e00-b486-d1883fdf28af Place the rack of lamb into a glass baking dish or a resealable plastic bag.
4a8e35d4-2d54-4e00-b486-d1883fdf28af Combine remaining ingredients and slather them over meat portion of the rack.
4a8e35d4-2d54-4e00-b486-d1883fdf28af Cover with plastic wrap or seal bag and allow the meat to marinate in the refrigerator for 8 to 12 hours.
4a8e35d4-2d54-4e00-b486-d1883fdf28af Remove rack of lamb from the baking dish (reserving the marinade). Wrap the bones with aluminum foil and place onto the grill. Make loosely-packed balls of aluminum foil to place under the tips of the bones to ensure they are up off the grill and won't get burned.
4a8e35d4-2d54-4e00-b486-d1883fdf28af Sear the rack of lamb for 2 minutes on each side. Then turn the heat down to medium (or move the meat to a cooler part of the grill).
4a8e35d4-2d54-4e00-b486-d1883fdf28af Cook the lamb for 30 to 40 minutes at medium heat, turning often and brushing with the reserved marinade throughout the cooking process.
4a8e35d4-2d54-4e00-b486-d1883fdf28af Once the lamb has reached the desired doneness, remove it from the heat. Rare lamb will be at 120 F (50 C) and medium at about 150 F (65 C). The rack of lamb will go up a few degrees in temperature after you remove it from the grill.
4a8e35d4-2d54-4e00-b486-d1883fdf28af Allow 5 to 10 minutes of resting time before carving.
4a8e35d4-2d54-4e00-b486-d1883fdf28af To carve, stand the rack up with the bones curving away from you. Using a sharp knife, slide the blade down between the bones gently. Cut the rack of lamb into chops by carving between each set of bones.
7b6400cc-6397-4976-b3d6-a8f40b476191 Combine vinegar, lemon zest with the herbs and spices. Marinate racks of lamb in this mixture for about 12 hours.
7b6400cc-6397-4976-b3d6-a8f40b476191 Preheat grill and prepare for indirect grilling at about 300 F.
7b6400cc-6397-4976-b3d6-a8f40b476191 Combine Dijon mustard, red wine, Worcestershire sauce and soy sauce in a bowl.
7b6400cc-6397-4976-b3d6-a8f40b476191 Remove lamb racks from marinade and place on grill over indirect heat. Grill for one hour or until done, basting with mustard sauce for the first 30 minutes.
7b6400cc-6397-4976-b3d6-a8f40b476191 Remove from grill when done (an internal temperature of 145 F.) and let rest for 10 minutes. Carve and serve.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Gather the ingredients.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Prepare the marinade by grinding the garlic, mint, cumin, salt, and paprika with a mortar and pestle. Alternatively, you can use a food processor. Grind ingredients into a paste and then add the olive oil and lemon juice. Mix well.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Make little incisions in the lamb and then coat it well with the marinade. Make sure you coat the inside and outside of the lamb thoroughly.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Place lamb in a bowl and cover. Place it in the fridge for at least 2 hours or even overnight.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Remove the lamb from the fridge 1 hour prior to cooking. Preheat the oven to 350 F.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Place the lamb in a baking dish and roast for 1 hour and 20 minutes for pink meat. Roast the lamb for an extra 20 minutes for medium to well-done meat.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Meanwhile, prepare the cucumber sauce. Mix together the yogurt, cucumber, garlic, lemon juice, mint, and cilantro. Add the salt and mix well. Set aside.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Prepare the couscous about 20 minutes before serving the lamb. Bring the vegetable stock to a boil in a small pot. Remove the pot from the heat and add the couscous. Cover and let it sit for about 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the couscous. Stir well with a fork. Add the curry powder and stir again. Next, add a pinch of salt.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Add the raisins and pine nuts to the couscous and stir with the fork.
78864e85-e497-4a8c-be55-f5bda0c87ed4 Remove the lamb when ready and slice it. Spoon some of the liquid from the pan onto the lamb. Serve on a bed of couscous and spoon the yogurt sauce on top.
c1f4445c-2263-4352-9345-df4e12a21b81 Gather the ingredients.
c1f4445c-2263-4352-9345-df4e12a21b81 To prepare yogurt sauce, combine all sauce ingredients in medium bowl. Make sure to squeeze grated cucumber, to release excess liquid before adding to mixture. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and place into refrigerator. Sauce can be made 1 to 6 hours in advance.
c1f4445c-2263-4352-9345-df4e12a21b81 Preheat grill for medium-high heat. To prepare burgers, combine ground lamb with lemon juice, zest, Worcestershire sauce, mint, onion powder, minced garlic, oregano, paprika salt and pepper. Form into 14 to 16 small patties, a little bigger than the buns. Place patties onto grill and cook for 4 to 5 minutes per side. Once cooked through, remove from heat, placed onto slider buns and top with yogurt sauce and red onion rings.
c9bf812e-e8c7-45c3-8e15-a84da1f09671 Place lamb chops in a shallow baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over chops. Cover and refrigerate for 4 to 24 hours.
c9bf812e-e8c7-45c3-8e15-a84da1f09671 Preheat grill for medium heat. Place chops on a well-oiled grill grate and cook for 4 to 5 minutes on each side.
c9bf812e-e8c7-45c3-8e15-a84da1f09671 Remove from heat and serve with your favorite chutney or yogurt sauce.
8edda9f0-40ae-46ed-9e5f-d23acc98b4b1 When you buy your leg of lamb, ask your butcher to clean off as much excess fat as possible. Then, have the leg separated into 3 pieces at the joints.
8edda9f0-40ae-46ed-9e5f-d23acc98b4b1 Preheat your oven to 285 F. Place the lamb in a shallow metal oven roasting tray. In a bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, and spices. Pour the mixture over the lamb.
8edda9f0-40ae-46ed-9e5f-d23acc98b4b1 Wearing rubber gloves, rub the mixture all over the lamb, massaging it into the meat for several minutes. Add the bay leaves and rosemary sprigs. Place the tray in the oven uncovered.
8edda9f0-40ae-46ed-9e5f-d23acc98b4b1 Let the lamb cook slowly at this low temperature for about 1 1/2 hours. You'll see that the meat will release its fat and juices, then reabsorb them as it cooks. After the first 30 minutes, turn the pieces of lamb over. Repeat this two more times during the cooking process.
8edda9f0-40ae-46ed-9e5f-d23acc98b4b1 When 1 1/2 hours have passed and you have turned the meat three times, pour the 1/2 cup of hot water over the meat, then close the roasting pan completely with aluminum foil. Turn up the oven temperature to 365 F and leave the meat to roast for at least 1 hour more.
8edda9f0-40ae-46ed-9e5f-d23acc98b4b1 After about 1 hour, remove the pan from the oven and let it rest for 5 minutes. Remove the foil. The meat should be very tender and fall cleanly off the bones. Using two forks, remove all the meat from the bones and discard them. Also, remove the bay leaves and rosemary.
8edda9f0-40ae-46ed-9e5f-d23acc98b4b1 Your kuzu tandr is ready to serve. Serve it with piping hot Turkish rice pilaf with orzo or with potato puree.
d7e7cb12-d9c8-4421-b15d-469767298e2b Layer the sliced onions on the bottom of a tagine. In a bowl, mix the meat with the chopped onion and spices, and add the mixture to the tagine along with the water, argan oil and olives. Place the cilantro bouquet on top of the meat.
d7e7cb12-d9c8-4421-b15d-469767298e2b Cover the tagine, and place it on a diffuser over medium-low heat. It will take some time for the tagine to reach a simmer, but once it does, leave the tagine undisturbed for about three hours, using the lowest heat necessary to maintain the simmer.
d7e7cb12-d9c8-4421-b15d-469767298e2b There's no need to open the tagine unless you smell something burning. In that case, the heat was likely too high and a little water will need to be added to prevent scorching.
d7e7cb12-d9c8-4421-b15d-469767298e2b After the tagine has cooked for three hours, check on the meat. It should be very tender and easy to break apart with your fingers. If necessary, cook longer. When the meat is tender, reduce any excess liquid, and serve.
cd6e31ca-00eb-4e9d-a10c-1e414ecf4734 Cut excess fat from leg of lamb.
cd6e31ca-00eb-4e9d-a10c-1e414ecf4734 Make six deep holes in lamb and insert one peeled clove of garlic into each hole. Set aside to allow it to reach room temperature.
cd6e31ca-00eb-4e9d-a10c-1e414ecf4734 Mix other ingredients in a large glass or plastic bowl.
cd6e31ca-00eb-4e9d-a10c-1e414ecf4734 Place boneless lamb leg into a large glass dish. Pour half of the marinade over top, making sure lamb is well coated. Reserve the other half of marinade for basting.
cd6e31ca-00eb-4e9d-a10c-1e414ecf4734 Cover with plastic wrap and place in refrigerator for 6 to 12 hours, turning over every hour or so.
cd6e31ca-00eb-4e9d-a10c-1e414ecf4734 Preheat grill.
cd6e31ca-00eb-4e9d-a10c-1e414ecf4734 Place lamb on rotisserie skewer and put it on the grill. Reduce temperature to low. Cook for 2 hours, brushing with reserved marinade every half hour.
cd6e31ca-00eb-4e9d-a10c-1e414ecf4734 Once lamb reaches desired doneness (between 145 F to 160 F, depending on how rare or well done you like it), remove from heat, place onto a large cutting board and tent loosely with aluminum foil. Let meat rest for 5 to 7 minutes before slicing.
cd6e31ca-00eb-4e9d-a10c-1e414ecf4734 Cut into thin slices. Serve with your favorite sides.
59de2651-421c-4749-a193-123b92bda74e Cut the meat and fat into bite-sized cubes and put it all in a saucepan. Add the salt and turn through with your hands.
59de2651-421c-4749-a193-123b92bda74e Turn the heat on high until the bottom begins to sizzle. Cover the pan and reduce the heat to low. Leave the pan to simmer very gently for several hours. Turn the meat over occasionally with a wooden spoon.
59de2651-421c-4749-a193-123b92bda74e Youll know the meat is ready when there is no liquid left except the melted fat and the meat is falling apart and has darkened in color.
59de2651-421c-4749-a193-123b92bda74e Serve the hot kavurma with a side dish of rice or bulgur pilaf and other traditional Turkish dishes.
b7a4f44a-04a2-4053-bd0c-2e135ec4e590 Place the lamb chops in a shallow baking dish or resealable plastic bag.
b7a4f44a-04a2-4053-bd0c-2e135ec4e590 Combine olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic, rosemary, honey, mustard, oregano, salt, and pepper. Mix well and pour over lamb chops. Gently toss to coat.
b7a4f44a-04a2-4053-bd0c-2e135ec4e590 Cover or seal bag and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours.
b7a4f44a-04a2-4053-bd0c-2e135ec4e590 Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
b7a4f44a-04a2-4053-bd0c-2e135ec4e590 Remove the chops and place onto grill grates.
b7a4f44a-04a2-4053-bd0c-2e135ec4e590 Discard marinade.
b7a4f44a-04a2-4053-bd0c-2e135ec4e590 Grill, the lamb, chops 4 to 5 minutes per side on until cooked to desired doneness.
57e9efb9-566e-418e-a402-2a8daae19206 Preheat grill for medium-high heat. (You can use a grill pan for indoor grilling as well.)
57e9efb9-566e-418e-a402-2a8daae19206 In a large bowl, combine ground lamb, chopped onion, bread crumbs, chopped mint, egg, garlic, cumin, black pepper, and Aleppo pepper (or pepper flakes).
57e9efb9-566e-418e-a402-2a8daae19206 Do not add salt at this point. Gently mix with hands until all ingredients are well combined. Form into 4 equal-sized patties and place onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
57e9efb9-566e-418e-a402-2a8daae19206 Using your thumb, make indentations halfway through the center of each patty. This will help the burgers to cook more evenly and not bubble up in the center.
57e9efb9-566e-418e-a402-2a8daae19206 Using folded paper towels and a pair of large grilling tongs (if you are grilling outdoors), oil the grill grates well. Make at least three passes, making sure that the surface is nice and coated.
57e9efb9-566e-418e-a402-2a8daae19206 Place lamb burger patties onto grill and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, or until meat has reached the desired doneness. Use a large outdoor cooking spatula to flip these burgers. They will be a bit softer than beef burgers, not only because of the texture of ground lamb but because these patties also contain some wet ingredients. If you are grilling indoors, oil up the grilling pan, using the same method as you would outdoors, and use a regular-sized spatula to flip the burgers.
57e9efb9-566e-418e-a402-2a8daae19206 Once cooked to your liking, remove from grill, place onto a plate and tent with aluminum foil. Brush burger buns with olive oil (vegetable oil work well too), and place oiled side down onto grill grates. Close the lid and let buns toast for 1 to 2 minutes. (If you are not grilling outdoors, toast your buns in a toaster oven for the same amount of time on the medium-low setting.) Remove. If using pita, place into a large piece of aluminum foil, seal edges and place onto the grill for 3 minutes, turn, and warm for another 3-4 minutes.
57e9efb9-566e-418e-a402-2a8daae19206 We recommend either a red pepper aioli or yogurt sauce for these burgers. For red pepper aioli, simply add the roasted red peppers to the mayonnaise in a food processor. Add the lemon juice, salt, and olive oil and blend to desired consistency.
57e9efb9-566e-418e-a402-2a8daae19206 For yogurt sauce, in a bowl add the cucumber, plain yogurt, minced garlic, cilantro, and salt, and stir together, until completely combined.
57e9efb9-566e-418e-a402-2a8daae19206 Assemble burgers to your liking and add extra items such as red onion and lettuce.
34658b4b-06b9-450f-8d88-d502f1fe2b42 Sprinkle lamb chops with salt and pepper.
34658b4b-06b9-450f-8d88-d502f1fe2b42 In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
34658b4b-06b9-450f-8d88-d502f1fe2b42 Lightly coat chops with flour; place in hot skillet. Sear until well browned, turning once. Remove to a plate and set aside. Reduce heat to medium.
34658b4b-06b9-450f-8d88-d502f1fe2b42 To the skillet add the mushrooms, green onions, garlic, and butter.
34658b4b-06b9-450f-8d88-d502f1fe2b42 Cook the vegetables, stirring, for 4 minutes. Add beef broth and red wine and simmer until reduced by about 1/3.
34658b4b-06b9-450f-8d88-d502f1fe2b42 Add lamb chops to the sauce, cover skillet, and cook for about 15 to 20 minutes, or until lamb chops are done as desired.
450e62fa-af2d-465f-b854-1b33d0cfcc39 Gather the ingredients.
450e62fa-af2d-465f-b854-1b33d0cfcc39 In a heavy duty zipper lock food storage bag, combine the thyme, rosemary, garlic, onion, oil, vinegar, orange juice, and mustard, and mix well.
450e62fa-af2d-465f-b854-1b33d0cfcc39 Add the leg of lamb; seal the bag, and turn to coat. Massage the meat through the bag for a bit to help the marinade penetrate into the meat. Put the storage bag into a large roasting pan and marinate for 24 hours in the refrigerator.
450e62fa-af2d-465f-b854-1b33d0cfcc39 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
450e62fa-af2d-465f-b854-1b33d0cfcc39 Remove the lamb from the marinade and place in shallow roasting pan. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper.
450e62fa-af2d-465f-b854-1b33d0cfcc39 Roast the lamb, uncovered, for 50 to 70 minutes or until an instant-read meat thermometer registers 140 F for medium-rare or 150 F for medium. Make sure the lamb is cooked to a minimum of 140 F for food safety reasons.
450e62fa-af2d-465f-b854-1b33d0cfcc39 Baste the lamb with the remaining marinade several times during the time it's in the oven, using all of the marinade.
450e62fa-af2d-465f-b854-1b33d0cfcc39 Remove the lamb from the oven, cover with foil, and let stand for 15 minutes before serving.
450e62fa-af2d-465f-b854-1b33d0cfcc39 Carve the lamb into slices against the grain.
450e62fa-af2d-465f-b854-1b33d0cfcc39 Serve with the sauce that forms in the bottom of the pan.
False False

b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c Kosher salt
b277ccc6-d904-4862-b351-c823a201af2c Black pepper (freshly ground)
